To honor, exalt, glorify; to conduct oneself with distinction. Mea hoʻohanohano, hōʻailona hoʻohanohano, insignia of distinction, regalia, decoration. Kekele hoʻohanohano, honorary degree. Medala hoʻohanohano, medal, as a military medal for merit.
See hanohano, glorious.
See HANO. To exalt one’s self above others; to conduct haughtily; to raise one to honor.
To cause to breathe, resuscitate, administer an inhalant. I ka hoʻohanuʻana o kou mau pukaihu, with the blast of your nostrils.
See HANUA, plane; level. To live independently; to have enough; to be supplied.
To be level; plane, as low level ground. See HONUA.
Redup. of hoʻohanu. Lāʻau hoʻohanuhanu, inhalant. Paʻakai hoʻohanuhanu, smelling salts.
See HANU, to breathe. To cause to breathe frequently; to draw the breath in and out.
To resuscitate; to revive from fainting.
To snuff up, as the wind.

example_txt.txt: Ke hoʻohao nei ke ahe makani.
The wafted breeze comes with force.

definitions.dtxt: Caus/sim of hao.
Caus/sim of haoa. Also hoʻohaʻoa, hoʻolaoa, hoʻolaʻoa.
See HAOHAO, to search. To seek; to cause a search after a thing; to hunt after.
To arouse wonder, surprise, puzzlement.
See haʻohaʻo, puzzling.

example_txt.txt: Americanized, Europeanized; to have become like a white person or have adopted the ways of a white man

definitions.dtxt: To act like a white person, to ape the white people, or assume airs of superiority [often said disparagingly, especially of half-whites]. (Marquesan haoʻe is probably a loan from Hawaiian.)
To cure, i.e., to prepare by chemical or physical processing for keeping or use. Comb. hoʻo- + hāoʻo. See hāoʻo.
To lessen, diminish.
To cause conception; to perform ceremonies or take treatment to induce conception.
Caus/sim of hāpai.
See HAPAI, to lift or raise up. To conceive, as a female; parallel with hoohanau.
definitions.notes: Note: Hoohanau and hoohapai are both factitious words and of modern date, and are not after Hawaiian idiom, as the Hawaiian has no words properly signifying to conceive as a mother, or to beget as a father; at least no such words have yet been discovered.

definitions.dtxt: To besmear, etc.
Caus/sim of hape. ʻŌlelo hoʻohape mai, to speak incorrectly.
See hape, incorrect.
To decompose, putrefy. Comb. hoʻo- + hāpopopo. See hāpopopo. Ka hoʻohāpopo eaea ʻana.
Same as above. E hoʻohauhau mai ʻoe i ka lau hala a kāua i palupalu, beat our pandanus leaf so as to soften it.
Caus/sim of hauhili; to cause confusion, as in speech.
See HILI, to wander, and HAUHILI. To cause a blundering in speaking; to talk foolishly without regard to truth.
Caus/sim haukaʻe; to spoil, as a ballot. Fig. To defile a reputation.
See haukaʻe, stained.
See HAUKAE, a sloven. To be a sloven, or to act in a slovenly manner; to be base in one’s conduct.
To drop, cause to fall. E hoʻohāʻule au i ka ua maluna o ka ʻili o ka honua (1 Nal 18.1), I will send rain upon the earth.
See hāʻule, to fall.
To darken.
To act as a pupil, become a pupil; to make pupils of.
To pollute, defile, befoul, besmirch, contaminate. Moe ihola me ia, a hoʻohaumia iāia, sleeping with her and defiling her.
See haumia, defilement.
See HAUMIA, filthy. To defile; to pollute; to cause to be unclean; to contaminate; to deface; to disfigure.
See kumu hoʻohaumia.
To deceive; to entice; to insnare.
To clasp around.
To seize with the hands, as something difficult to hold.
To stuff the vagina in order to produce abortion.
To cause an offensive odor; to use strong-smelling bait to attract fish; to smell such an odor. Iʻa hoʻohauna, same as iʻa hoʻomelu; see melu.
To provoke panic, riot; agitator. Hoʻohaunaele i nā ʻaha hoʻokolokolo, contempt of court.
See haunaele, panic.
See HAUNAELE. To cause a disturbance; to get up a riot; to do mischief in a mass.
Proud.
To cause happiness, gaiety, joy. Mea hoʻohauʻoli, entertainment, pleasure, treat.
See HAUOLI, joy. To cause joy; to rejoice.
To cause to recollect, recall.
See UWA and UWAUWA, to gabble. To talk all together; to make confusion by a multitude talking all at once.
Caus/sim of hauwawā; provocative of loud noise.
Caus/sim of hauwene; to tease others.
To act as a Hawaiian; to ape or imitate Hawaiians.
Same as hōhē, coward.
To cause to slip, slide, flee; to put to flight, rout. Hoʻoheʻe kī, ti leaf sliding.
See heʻe, to slide.
See HEE, to melt; to flow. To cause to melt; to flow, as a liquid.
To cause to flee; to put to flight; to rout, as an army. See AUHEE.
To leach, i.e., subject to the action of percolating liquid. Comb. hoʻo- + heʻeaholo. See heʻeaholo.
Redup. of hoʻoheʻe; to slide, slip.
Freq. of hoohee. Also, to make angry; to vex; to be wild.
To melt easily; to run into liquid.
To flee or run away; to act the coward. See HOHE.

To melt, liquefy, cast, dissolve, soften; to slide, especially to slide by jerks, as on a hōlua, sled, or ti-leaf slide. Wahi hoʻoheheʻe hao, foundry. Wai hoʻoheheʻe, digestive juice. E hoʻoheheʻe ʻoe i ʻehā ʻapo gula, thou shalt cast four rings of gold.
See heheʻe 1.
See HEE, to melt. To melt away; to run, as a liquid; to liquify, as any hard substance.
To dissolve (something). See entry below.
To digest food. Trad. See hoʻowali ʻai, hoʻonapele (dic.). ʻŌnaehana hoʻoheheʻe meaʻai. Digestive system.

Caus/sim of hehelo. Nā pāpale hulu manu like ʻole o nā aliʻi e hoʻohehelo ana i ka ʻōnohi o ka lā, the hats of the varying bird feathers of the chiefs shining brightly within the eyeball [sight] of the sun.
See HEHELO. To be proud; to be proud of one’s appearance or dress; to be deceitful.
Caus/sim of hehena. ʻO kāna mau hana lapuwale, he mea hoʻohehena i ka noʻonoʻo maikaʻi, his wretched actions drive a sane mind mad.
Caus/sim of heheo; to swish, swirl; to swish up and down on the foot, as a child.
See HEO. To swell out; to be large, as a woman with a large pau.

To snare, tangle, rope, lasso; to beset with difficulties; to infatuate, be enraptured. Hoʻohei manaʻo, to infatuate, beguile; spellbound. Hoʻohei pipi, to rope cattle. Ka hoʻohei ʻana i nā pua, catching fish fry. E hoʻohei aʻe ʻoe i kānaka, you shall catch [by fishing] men. Hoʻohei manaʻo, to cast a spell, enchant, beguile.
See hei, snare.
See HEI, a snare or net. To set a net or snare; to be entangled in a snare.
To beset with difficulties.
Caus/sim of heihei; to fascinate, flirt; to ward off possible sorcery by imitating the gestures of the kahuna.
To run swiftly, take part in a race, pretend to race, cause to race.
See heihei, race, and heihei 2, 3.
To ensnare, entrap; to mend, as a net or wire fence.
A drum; a playing on the drum.
To sound or strike on the drum.
Street name.
See ʻōheke.
To cause thunder; threatening thunder storm.
See HEKILI, thunder. To cause it to thunder.
Street name.

To cause to move, set in motion; to start, as a clock; to manage; to walk someone else or force oneself to walk. Kō kākou mau hoʻohele ʻana, our management. E hoʻohele aku ʻoe i ka uaki, start the watch.
To imitate, pretend; imitative, pretending. ʻA hoʻohele, to eat in an imitative fashion. Nīnau hoʻohele, indirect questioning.
See hele 1, 2.
See HELE, to move. Movable; moving.
See HELE and MAHELE, to divide. To go between; to divide; to separate by cutting, as cutting cloth with shears.
To lead up to a subject in a roundabout way, hint, suggest.
To pull down, as the eyelid; to stretch, as the mouth.
Caus/sim of helei. Noho hoʻohelei i ka ʻūhā, to sit with legs stretched far apart [considered indecent].
To scatter, sow; to fall, as rain. Ke hoʻoheleleʻi mai nei, it’s beginning to rain. (Probably PPN felelei, a reciprocal derivative of lele.)
See heleleʻi, falling.
See HELELEI, to scatter. To scatter, as in sowing grain; to throw away.
To utilize guided imagery. Lit. cause to imagine.
Caus/sim of helu; numerator, in fractions; a telling, explanation.

example_txt.txt: Nui kona hoʻohemahema i ke aʻo a nā kūpuna.
He was most neglectful of the teachings of the grandparents.
a bailer left unnoticed [a skilled person whose services are not used]

definitions.dtxt: To neglect, not care for; careless, negligent, defective, deficient, ignorant.
See HEMA, left (hand.) To be unfurnished; unprepared; not ready.
To be wanting in some important quality or thing.
To cause a destitution; to deprive of.
To dislike and take no care of; applied to all things not desired.
To set no value upon; hoohemahema i ka waiwai, waiho wale a lilo ia hai.

example_txt.txt: hoʻohemo i ka ʻono o ka lama

definitions.dtxt: To loosen, undo, unfasten, disconnect, take off, set at liberty, liberate, free, abort.
See hemo, loose.
See HEMO, to loosen. To make loose; to loosen; to set at liberty.
To disconnect, as in computer program. Cf. hoʻokuʻi. See entry below.
To get oneself open, as for a play in basketball. See hemo.

example_txt.txt: Kīloi mau ʻia ke kinipōpō iā Kaina, no ka mea, ʻeleu ʻo ia i ka hoʻohemo.
The ball always gets passed to Kaina since he’s so quick to make himself open.

definitions.dtxt: Caus/sim of hemohemo; to take off.
Freq. of hoʻohemo. To make loose.
To make holy; to feign holiness. Ua hoʻohemolele lākou i kou nani, they have perfected your beauty.
To drive off, scare away, as hens.
See HEMU, to drive away. To scare away; to frighten; to drive off, as hens, pigs or other animals.
To see, feel, or handle the hena; to take off one’s clothing and expose the hena.
See HENA, thigh. To see, feel or handle the thigh; to take off one’s clothes.
Intensive of the foregoing. To act lasciviously; to uncover one’s nakedness; to dress so as to show the hena.
Same as hoʻohenehene, to tease.
See HENE, mockery. To cause mockery; to show contempt.
To tease, laugh at, jeer, banter, ridicule.
To tease. See henehene.
See hoʻohene. To cause laughter at another’s expense or feelings; to mock; to vilify.
Street name.

To cherish, love, caress; affectionate, demonstrative of affection; expression of affection, as a song. Hoʻoheno hoʻi kēia wahi keiki, this little child is so affectionate. Nona nei hoʻoheno, this song is for him.
To cherish. See heno.
Caus/sim of henoheno.
Proud, vaunting, vain; to show off, boast.
See HEO, pride. To be proud; vaunting; lofty.
To make artistic, decorate artistically. See heona.
Caus/sim of hepa. ʻŌlelo hoʻohepa, idiotic talk; to mispronounce or misconstrue language.
See HEPA, to be silent. To be mischievous; to be careless; to imitate another.
Caus/sim of hepahepa.
See HOOHEPA. To talk improperly, as imitating the talk of foreigners.
To mispronounce words or misconstruct language; e hookahuli i ka olelo.
See heu, down.
See HEU, a beginning. To open a speech; to commence a talk.
Caus/sim of heu; to grow, sprout, germinate; pubescence.

To cause one to do wrong, cause or feign a mistake; to blame, condemn. (Cf. the more common hoʻāhewa, to condemn.) Hoʻohewa ʻia, convicted. ʻŌlelo hoʻohewa, to make errors in speech on purpose. Mai ʻai ʻoe ia mea, ua hoʻohewa ka ʻāina nou, eat not this thing, cursed is the ground for your sake.
See hewa, mistake.
See HEWA, wrong; error. To condemn; to convict of crime or misdemeanor; to accuse one of crime; to punish. See AHEWA.
See ʻōhewa, delicious.
To fail to recognize.
See HOOHEWA, to cause to do or be in error. To forget; to mistake; to forget the name of a person.
To mistake one person for another; to be doubtful with regard to a thing.
To be slightly deranged; to be delirious; but not so strong as hehena or pupule.
See HOOHEWA and WALE, gratuitously. To condemn without cause; to oppress; to injure.
definitions.notes: Note: This word is often divided into two words in writing, and perhaps should always be.

definitions.dtxt: Caus/sim of hī; to purge.
To open; to dissolve; to act as a cathartic; e hoomama.
Caus/sim of hia. (FOR. 6:419)
To cause sleeplessness. He mea hoʻohiaʻā ke kope, coffee causes sleeplessness.
To delight, enchant, entrance.
Caus/sim of hiahia.
To be good; honorable; noble in aspect and deportment.
To have the outward appearance of a gentleman without the substance.
To be proud and vain. See HOOMAHIE.
To eat with greediness; to cram down food; to swallow, as one insatiate.
In a moral sense, to swallow down iniquity; no ka mea, ke hoohiala ae nei oukou i ka hewa iloko o oukou iho.
Caus/sim of hialaʻai. Koʻu nanea hoʻohialaʻai, my delightful relaxation.
Hoohiala and ai, food.
To stuff with food.
To be intent on evil; e hana mau ma ka hewa.
Street name.
See hiamoe, sleep.
See HIAMOE, to sleep. To cause one to sleep.
To be lazy; to be weary; to be dull.
See HIAPO. To be constituted a first born; to have the privileges of a first born.
Street name.
To make or cause to appear distinguished; distinguished, stately, regal; delightful.
See hie, attractive.
See HIE, excellent. To make or cause to be excellent; to be grand to look at.
To be proud; to be haughty; to carry a high head.

To beautify, make distinctive, beautiful, elegant; distinguished in manner or appearance. ʻO ke aloha … ʻaʻole hoʻi e hoʻohiehie, charity … does not act elegantly. Hoʻohiehie launa ʻole, showy, superlatively decorated, gaudy, gorgeous.
See HIEHIE, pride, etc. To show a proud behavior; to act proudly.
To cause entanglement; to entwine, entangle.
Offensive; injurious.
See HIHI, to entangle. To cause entanglement; to get entangled in any way.
To desire to get what is another’s.
To get into difficulties, entangle, perplex, beset with trouble, complicate. Ka hoʻohihia ʻana o kēia kanaka iā kākou, this man is a snare to us.
See hihia, entangled.
See HIHIA, entanglement. To get one into difficulty; to entrap; to hold fast.
To cause to fall; to sway to and fro. E hoʻohihina nohoʻi ke kino i mua a i hope, i ka ʻakau a i ka hema, the body sways forward and back, to the right and to the left.
To cause fear, frighten.
See HOOHIU above. To cause fear; to be fearful; to make afraid; hence, to make or be wild; to be untamed.
Caus/sim of hiʻi.
See HII, to carry a child. To lift up, as a child in the arms to carry.

example_txt.txt: Ā e hoʻohīkākā aku ʻoia iā lākou mehe mea ʻona lā.
And he makes them stagger like a drunken man.

definitions.dtxt: Caus/sim of hīkākā.
See HIKAKA, to stagger. To lean this way and that, as a rickety grass house; to lean over.
To stagger in walking, like a drunken man.
Street name.
To cause to come, arrive, appear. Hoʻohiki wawe, to rush, come fast, speed up, expedite.
To vow, swear. See -hiki.
A vow; a promise; a prayer; a swearing. Hoohiki wahahee, a false swearing.
See HIKI, to come to. To arrive at a place, especially at a place designated.
To vow; to swear to a fact; to adjure on oath.
To swear at; to reproach; to revile; mostly with ino.
See palapala hoʻohiki.
Caus/sim of hikihiki.
To bear or carry frequently; to carry a little at a time.
To startle, shock. He mea hou hoʻohikilele, shocking news.
See HIKILELE, to startle. To startle one; to cause one to jump; to startle with affright; to wake one suddenly, as from sleep.
To accelerate, hurry, hasten.
Caus/sim of hila.
See HILA. To cause shame; to be ashamed.

To make ashamed or embarrassed; to disgrace, humiliate; shameful, bashful, timid. Hana hoʻohilahila, disgraceful behavior or acts. Hoʻohilahila nohoʻi ʻoe iaʻu, you've made me ashamed; I’m ashamed of you.
See hilahila, bashful.
Bashful; modest, as a backwoodsman; he hoolua nui ke kuaaina, he hoohilahila.

See HILAHILA. To be timid; modest; fearful, as a bashful person; hence, to be affected with shame; to make ashamed; to act with modesty; to put one to shame, by his own superiority. Laieik. 138. E hoohilahila aku ai ia Laieikawai.
Caus/sim hilala; to cause to swing back and forth; to lean over, tilt.
See HILALA, to bend; to crook. To bend, as the slim branches of a tree with the wind; to curve; to bend round, as a hook.
Caus/sim of hili; to lead astray.
Caus/sim of hili; to pretend to whip, to whip gently.
See hili, to turn, and hili, to whip.
See HILI, to wander. To wander from the right path; to wander; to go here and there without object.
To dye.
Redup. of hoʻohili.
See HILI. To cause to wander often.
To besmear with blood; to defile with blood.
Caus/sim of hilikau. Hoʻohilikau i nā wāwae, to trip someone.
To blow a conch or wind instrument.
No definition given.**
Caus/sim of hilo.
See HILO, to twist. To cause to twist; to spin or twist, as a cord.
See HILU, to be glorious. To exalt; to praise; to dignify.
Street name.
To beautify, bedeck, decorate. Hoʻohiluhilu kula, golden finery, jewelry.
See the foregoing. To exalt; to praise; to honor; to dignify.
Fancy, elegant.
To throw, cause to fall, knock down; to lean over.
See hina, to fall.
To tackle (someone), in football. Also kulaʻi. Cf. kūlua.

To shine, polish; to show off (Kel. 130). Keiki hoʻohinuhinu kāmaʻa, shoe sinner, bootblack. Hoʻohinuhinu mikiʻao, fingernail polish. Eʻ hoʻohinuhinu ana ʻa Keola i kona kāmaʻa, Keola is polishing his shoes.
See hinuhinu 1, 2.
Var. of hoʻohiluhilu. Ua hoʻohinuhinu loa ʻo Makaliʻi i kāna wahine, ā ua nani loa (FOR. 4:81), Makaliʻi bedecks his wife and [she is] very beautiful.
Kīkina hoʻohinuhinu. Spray wax. Mea hoʻohinuhinu. Polish, i.e., a substance used to give smoothness or shine. ʻAila hoʻohinuhinu. Wax, as for polishing a car.
Caus/sim of hiō.
See HIO, to lean. To cause to lean or slant from a perpendicular; to bend over.
To stagger in walking.
To italicize. See hiō.

example_txt.txt: E aho nō kēia huaʻōlelo ke hoʻohiō ʻia.
It would be better if this word were italicized.

definitions.dtxt: To tip or tilt, as a glass containing water.
Redup. of hoʻohiō.
Caus/sim of hiohiolo; to hang or drape festively.
To overthrow, demolish, raze.
See HIOLO, to fall down. To overthrow; to cause to roll down or away; to throw down; to demolish.
Caus/sim of hiolohia.
Affection; attachment.
See HIPA. To vow; to perform a vow.
To speak falsely.
To blunder in speaking; to speak falsely.
To tie, bind.
See HIPUU, a little bag or bundle for carrying provisions. To make up into a bundle; to bundle up for carrying.
Caus/sim of hiu.  Ua hoʻohiu ʻia ka moku i luna o ke alahukimoku, the ship was lifted onto the marine railway.
See HIU, strong; fierce. To be wild; to be fierce; to be untamed.
To be unfriendly; to be unsociable.
To fear; to be afraid.

To honor, adorn, decorate; to display, as the flag; to treat as a favorite; festive. He mea hoʻohiwahiwa i ke akua, a thing to honor the gods. ʻO ka mea hoʻohiwahiwa i kāna kauā mai kona wā ʻuʻuku mai, he who delicately brings up his servant from his childhood.
See hiwahiwa, precious.
See HIWA, black; acceptable to the gods. To be acceptable to the gods; to be dear; to be greatly beloved; to honor; to treat as beloved or precious.
To be downright skin and bones.
See oho, to call.
A shout; an exclamation of joy; to triumph.
See HO, to cry out. To shout or cry out, as a single person; to call after one.
To exclaim with many voices; holo ka moku makai, hele na kanaka mauka e hooho hele ai, the ship went on the sea, the men went on shore with vociferation.
To make the low noise of a horse.
To exclaim. ʻŌlelo hoʻōho. Exclamatory statement; to make such a statement.
Street name.
To make friends.
See hoa, companion, and -hoa.
See HOA, to drive cattle. To challenge; to dare one to fight; to provoke to anger.
Caus/sim of hoahoa.
Frequentative of hoʻohoa.
Street name.
To make friends, be friendly, befriend.
Caus/sim of hoe.; to have a canoe paddled. (PPN fohe)
Caus/sim of hohō.; to cause a snort.
To force out; to emit wind.
Caus/sim of hohoka.
Caus/sim of hoholo. Hoʻohoholo ʻia akula ka hūpē i loko, snuffle up mucus.
To cause or produce such an odor.
See hohono, acrid odor.
See HOHONO, strong smelling. To give or cause a strong offensive smell, like tar, sulphur and decaying fish.
To deepen.
See hohonu, deep.
Street name.
To entertain, amuse, charm, delight, encourage, please.
See hoihoi, pleased.
To cause disappointment, chagrin; to frustrate, thwart, put to shame.
See hoka, disappointed.
See HOKA, disappointed. To cause a mistake or error; to disappoint one.
Caus/sim of hokahoka.
To make frequent mistakes or blunders; to be disappointed.
To cause confusion, mix up, bother; to blot out the memory.
See hoku.
Daughter of Wākea and Papa.
To preserve for another.
See HOLI, to do first. To come out, as the first beard of a young man.
To make one’s first effort to do a thing. See HOOHEU.

example_txt.txt: E hoʻoholo ʻia e ka Mōʻī.
Be it enacted by the King.
hoʻoholo hou ʻana i ka waiwai
hoʻoholo ʻia ka ʻōlelo hoʻopaʻi no ka hewa

definitions.dtxt: To decide, determine, enact, pass, resolve, enforce, appraise, settle, conclude; to manage, as a business; decision, judgment. Cf. ʻōlelo hoʻoholo.

example_txt.txt: hoʻoholo i ka wai o ka lua

definitions.dtxt: To sail, run; to cause to run, sail, run free, as a horse; to ride, as a horse; to add water, as to poi; to flush, as a toilet; to drive, as a carriage.
See holo, to run; holo, decided; and -halo.
A rider on a horse; a horseman; more generally united with lio; as,
See HOLO, to run. To cause to run; to run along a road.
To move in various ways; to sail; to set sail; as a vessel; to ride on horseback.
To thrust the hand into, as into the bosom; to stretch out the hand, as in gesturing.
To agree, as a deliberate assembly; to pass, as a vote; to confirm an assertion.
To control, as in a computer program.
To start, as a machine; to play, as a film or tape. See hoʻokuʻu.
Caus/sim of holoāiʻa. ʻO ke ʻano e hoʻoholoāiʻa ʻia ai ka moku kaua, mamuli ia o kona hoʻopahū ʻia ana aʻe, the way the warship was sunk, because of being bombed.
To take someone out for a drive or excursion; to escort; to help walk, as a child or invalid. Hoʻoholoholo waʻa (FOR. 4:161), to sail canoes.
Caus/sim of holoholo.; to make large running stitches. Lopi hoʻoholoholo, basting thread.
To take someone for a drive or ride.
Caus/sim of holoholoʻōlelo.
To have washed, cleaned; to pretend to wash.
To draw a conclusion. Lit. determine a conclusion.

data.word: hoʻoholo i ke kū i ka hewa

definitions.dtxt: To convict, i.e., to find or prove to be guilty. Na ke kiule i hoʻoholo i kōna kū i ka hewa i ka pepehi kanaka. The jury convicted him of murder. Lit. determine to be in error.
To promote, cause progress; advancement, success.
To drive a car or carriage.
Same as above; horseman; to make a horse run.
A horseman; cavalry.
Caus/sim holo manaʻo. Ka poʻe i hoʻoholo manaʻo, those who took counsel.
Mākau hoʻoholo manaʻo. Decision-making skill.
To sail.
Holo and moku, a vessel. One who sails or causes a ship to sail.
Holo and moku, ship. To sail or to direct the sailing of a ship; applied either to the master or men.
Caus/sim of holoʻōlelo.
Inductive reasoning, i.e., generalizing from examples, in math. Lit. decide concerning examples.
Caus/sim of holu.; to bend, move up and down, sway.
See HOLU, to bend. To bend; to arch; to crook; to be flexible.
Caus/sim of holuholu.
See HOLU, to bend. To bend, as a flexible piece of timber; to bend, as a stick.
Blowing of the wind; palm fronds and tree branches sway, and whitecaps form on the ocean, in meteorology. Comb. hoʻo- + holu nape. See makani.
Caus/sim of hone.
To cause or pretend to kiss.
Caus/sim of honi.

definitions.der: [PPN fonu, full, as of liquid; PCP fofonu, deep]
definitions.dtxt: To deepen.
Street name.
To establish land, act as land; to scoop out earth, as for a fireplace; firmly established. Fig. Rich (rare).
To evoke or produce doubt, fear, anxiety.
See hopohopo, anxiety.
Street name.
To leaven, cause to rise, inflate, swell, overflow; yeast, baking powder.
See hū, to swell.
To cause someone to deviate from the path; to shoo, drive away, rout.
See HU, to rise. To cause to rise; to swell, as leaven.
To bake in an oven.
To start up suddenly.
To run along the bank of a kalo patch.
To detect; to discover.
Caus/sim of ʻōhū.
Perhaps hoohuwa, to lengthen out the time. To persevere long; to continue in a practice; to retain a habit, good or bad, especially the latter.
See HUA, fruit. To cause to swell, as a bud; to produce fruit, as a tree; to bring forth, as a female.
To tease or vex by begging; to resort often to one for favors.
To persevere in, as in any habit; ke hoohua nei ke noi a na kanaka i kela mea i keia mea; hoohua kanaka i ka inu rama, men persevere in drinking rum.
Street name.
To bear fruit, reproduce, produce, yield; to sire or give birth; to swell high, as a wave (UL 36). Nalu hoʻohua, a swelling wave. Hoʻohua kawowo, a medicine for women to induce conception.
See hua, fruit.

To have as a result, because of, ever since (followed by nō). Hoʻohua nō ka make ʻana o ka makua kāne, pau kō mākou ʻike ʻana iāia, ever since his father’s death, we've never seen him again. Hoʻohua nō i ka huhū ʻana o ke kupuna, ʻo ka hele nō ia, because of his grandparent’s anger, he departed.
ʻŌnaehana hoʻohua. Reproductive system, in biology.
See huʻa. hoʻohuʻa To insist, persist. Hoʻohuʻa nohoʻi i ka inu lama, persisting in drinking intoxicants.
To provoke anger or jealousy.
See HU. To cause to overflow; to have more than enough; to allow to escape.
To make the huahua gesture.
See HUA, to swell. To cause to enlarge; to increase; to grow in size. See MAHUAHUA.
Caus/sim of huʻahuʻa.
To question captiously, etc. See above.

Caus/sim of huahualau.; to cross-examine. Naʻu naʻe i hoʻohuahualau aku, ā no laila, hū mai koʻu aloha (Laie 607), I used devious methods and then my love poured forth. Ua hoʻohuahualau mai ia iā mākou me kāna ʻōlelo ʻinoʻino (3 Ioane 10), he prattles against us with, his evil words.
Puzzling; captious; olelo hoohuahualau, insidious questioning.
To question with belief or with unbelief; o ka poe hoomaloka, hoohuahualau mai i ke akua noho, the unbelieving question the existence of the resident gods.
To question in sport or derision, the person questioned being ignorant of the design.
To puzzle with captious questions; to throw difficulties in the way of explanation; to talk strangely.
To make one’s self strange; to pretend not to be acquainted.
To cast a shadow or reflection.
To cause a gleam of light, flash, glimmer.
To smoke tobacco constantly.
Hurt, angry, displeased, resentful. Also hoʻokuakeʻeo, kaʻeo, hoʻokeʻeo, hoʻokeʻekeʻe.
Pride; disdain; contempt for one.
See HUA, jealousy, and KAEO or KEEO. To be evilly disposed; to cherish a bad disposition.
To reject a proffered gift; to turn away with disdain; to be displeased.
To consent against one’s will; to consent in anger.
Street name.
Caus/sim of huali; to polish. Mehe ʻōlinolino lā ke nānā aku, a me ke keleawe hoʻohuali ʻia, like the brightness of the sun to look upon, and gleaming bronze.
See HUALI, to glitter. To shine with brightness; to glitter with a pure white.
To make pure; to cleanse; hence, to be shining.
To lengthen, continue, make a tail; to stream down, as water over a cliff.
See HUELO, the tail of an animal. To lengthen out; to make small by drawing out in length.
To provoke anger, pretend anger. Mai hoʻohuhū aku iāia, do not rebel against him.
See huhū, angry.
See HU and HUHU, anger. To make angry; to provoke; to be very angry.
To pull, cause to pull. Fig. Headstrong.
See huhuki, to pull.
To act as a man and his wife when they quarrel and she sets out to leave her husband and he catches her and they have a tussle, that is, to hoohuhuki; e hoonanai, e hookano.
Street name.
To form a society. Palapala hoʻohui, charter, as of an association.

To join, as two words; to add a prefix or suffix; to add on, annex, append, unite; to introduce one person to another; meeting of persons; binder. Hoʻohui ʻia, united, allied. Hoʻohui ā hoʻopaʻa, to bring together, consolidate. Hoʻohui ʻana, union, joining. Hoʻohui ʻāina, joining of lands, annexation. Hoʻohui helu, to connect, as telephone numbers by a telephone operator. Ka hoʻohui o ka mīkini humuhumu, sewing machine binder.
See hui, club, and hui, to join.
See HUI, to unite. To cause a union between two or more things; to add to; to add on; to annex.

To add, in math; to connect, as dots, etc. Cf. hōʻuluʻulu. Helu hoʻohui. Addend. Kumu hoʻohui pālima. Base five, in math. Also kumu pālima. Kōkua helu kumu hoʻohui pālima. Base-five counting piece. Pepa makaʻaha kumu hoʻohui pāʻumi. Base-ten grid paper.
Caus/sim of huihui. Hoʻohuihui lāʻau, chemistry, pharmacist. Mea hoʻohuihui, alloy, anything mixed. Mea inu hoʻohuihui, mixed drink, punch.
To make cold, chill, as by refrigeration. Mea inu hoʻohuʻihuʻi, iced or chilled drink.
See huʻihuʻi, cold.
Caus/sim of huikau., to mix, confuse, complicate, perplex, scramble.
See huikau, mixed.
To carve or sharpen into a point.
To go in the night without a light.
Street name.
Caus/sim of huki.; to pull gently.
See huki, to pull.
Caus/sim of hukihuki.
To project, protrude.
To cause someone to dance; to pretend to hula.
Caus/sim of hulā.
To destroy; to finish up; to punish; to tremble for fear.
Caus/sim of hulali.
Caus/sim of hulei. to trot, cause to trot, move back and forth.
To cry out hurra (hu-re)! to ride rapidly on a horse and cry out hurra!
Caus/sim of hūleilei.; to toss, as a child on one’s foot.

example_txt.txt: to drive cattle; cattle roundup; also huli pipi

definitions.dtxt: Caus/sim of huli.
See huli, to turn, and huli, to look for.
To turn, change, affect, overturn, convert, reform. (PPN fuli).
See HULI, to turn. To turn; to change; to cause an overturn; to express in another manner the same thing.
To flip, as to turn a figure to its reverse side, in math. Cf. hoʻoneʻe.
Caus/sim of hulihuli.; to convert.
See HULI above. To change; to turn; to put in order; to overturn; to mix up.
Street name.
To induce change of opinion, influence, convert.
To induce change of opinion, persuade.
Caus/sim of hulō.
Street name.
To esteem, prize.

chants.chtran: If you then were a bird flying above, this companion would nurse great esteem.
chants.chtxt: Inā hoʻi ʻoe he manu lele i luna, hoʻohulu aku ua hoa nei.

definitions.dtxt: See hulu, esteemed.
To put a loincloth on another.
To make someone sew.

example_txt.txt: Ua hoʻohūnā ʻoe i ka naʻauao mai kō lākou naʻau aku.
You have closed their minds to understanding.

definitions.der: [PPN fuu, PNP fuuna- (Rennell huunaki), PEP naʻa]
definitions.dtxt: To hide deliberately.
See hūnā, to hide.
See HUNA, to conceal. To hide; to secrete; to conceal.
Caus/sim of hunāhunā. Nīnau hoʻohunāhunā, to ask in a roundabout way.
See above. To hide frequently or thoroughly.
To cause poverty, impoverish. E hoʻohune iā mākou, to impoverish us.
See HUNE, to tease. To tease; to beg often; to ask something from another; to entreat a favor; to persist in, as in a bad habit.
To wonder.
To suspect, surmise distrust; suspicion. Ka huwā, ka paio, ka nuku, ka hoʻohuoi ʻino, envy, strife, railings, evil surmisings.
See huoi, suspicion.
Jealousy; o ka hoohuoi o na kanaka ame na 'lii i na misionari, the jealousy of the people and chiefs respecting the missionaries.
Causing jealousy; distrusting one’s faithfulness; he mea hoohuoi ia Halaaniani ka nalo ana o Laieikawai. See Laieik. 128.

See HUOI, jealousy. To be jealous; to feel jealous towards another for some real or supposed advantage; ina i noho lakou me kekahi alii, hoohuoi kekahi alii, if they had lived with a particular chief, another chief would have been jealous.
To allow to touch; to permit to blow upon, as the wind. Laieik. 17.
To feign ignorance, act dumb. Also hoʻopalō.
To imply. Ke hoʻohuʻu mai nei ʻoe naʻu i hana? Are you implying that I did it? (Tongan fakahuʻu.) See huʻu.
Same as hoʻohuakeʻeo.

To excel; best. Hōʻoi i ka pili, to raise a bet. Nā pono kaulele hōʻoi (song), the gains over and above. [In divination, a priest may put two piles of pebbles under a tapa; then he counts the pebbles in each pile by twos; if none are left over in the would-be thief’s pile this is called even (pahu); this means bad luck for the thief if his would-be victim is odd. If both piles are odd, or both piles are even, this, too, is indicative of failure. Having an odd number is good if the victim has an even number. (FOR. 6:73)]
To sharpen.
To cause to limp, pretend to limp.
Street name.
Auditor.
Certificate.
To confirm, affirm, guarantee, audit, verify, profess.
See ʻoia, truth.
For hoooia. See OIA.
To verify, check, give proof, as for a math problem.

To verify, certify, check, convince, make sure, prove; to acknowledge, as a title; deed, proof, verification. Hōʻoiaʻiʻo ʻana, acknowledgments. Ma laila i hōʻoiaʻiʻo ai lāua i kō lāua mau minute ʻoluʻolu (Laie 581), there they fulfilled their minutes of pleasure.
See ʻoiaʻiʻo, true.
A pledge for something promised.
Hooia and io, really. To prove, etc.; to substantiate as a fact.
Caus/sim of ʻieʻie.
Proud; vain; light minded. See above.
See IEIE.

To industrialize; developing, as a Third World Couentry. I ka wā. hōʻoiʻenehana o nā ʻāina o ʻEulopa, kūkulu nui ʻia nā hale wili like ʻole he nui. In the industrialization period of the European nations, many factories of various types were built. Comb. hō- + ʻoiʻenehana. Cf. ʻoiʻenehana. ʻĀina hōʻoiʻenehana. Developing couentry; Third World Couentry.
Bloated, uncomfortable.
See IHA. To draw tightly, as a rope; to be intent.
See IHO, to descend. To cause to descend; to go down; e hooiho ana ka waa i Oahu.
Freq, of iho.
Descent, slope; to descend, go south. (PPN hifonga).
See HOOIHO and ANA. A road leading down hill; a descending.
To contort the features; to pucker, shrink, contract, wrinkle, scowl.
Freq, of ika. See HOOIKA.
To put or throw ashore; to float, strike, drift.
See īkā, to drift.
See IKA, to float ashore. To go ashore from a boat or canoe; to put ashore, as from a canoe; to throw on a bank from any water.
Street name.
Var. of hōʻikaika.
See IKAIKA, strong. To make strong; in a reciprocal sense, to make one’s self strong.
To strengthen; to encourage; to animate.
Inservice teacher training. Lit. strengthen teacher. Cf. hoʻomākaukau kumu.
Aerobic. Lit. strengthen heart. Cf. eaea. See ʻonilele. Hana hoʻoikaika puʻuwai. Aerobic activity. ʻAi hoʻoikaika puʻuwai. Aerobic point.
See IKE and HOIKE. To show; to make known; to exhibit; to enlighten.
To charge, as a battery. Comb. hoʻo- + ikehu.
Street name.
To lessen, diminish, make small.
See iki, small.
See IKI, little. To make small; to diminish; to hold back.
Street name.
To bequeath or leave in a will; to lay aside, save.
To land upon, loud, as freight on a ship; to transfer, consign, transmit; to set on shore.
See ili, stranded, and ili, inheritance.
Articles of supply, as for family use; he nui no ka maona ma ke kuaaina, he maona hooili; something to eat and lay aside.
See ILI, to strike. To hit upon; to put upon, as to put on board a ship; to place upon, as upon the shoulders.
Distribution, to distribute, distributive, in math.
To download, as in computer program. Cf. hoʻouka. See mīkini hoʻoili kiʻi.
To hand off (the ball), in football.

example_txt.txt: Ua hoʻoili aku nei ʻo ia i ke kinipōpō i ka helu 42.
He handed off the ball to number 42.

definitions.dtxt: To transfer, as funds in a bank account. See entries below.
To transplant. Cf. ili. See ʻanopili hoʻoili.
See ILI and ILIILI, to collect. To collect in store; to gather together; to gather in heaps.
Street name.
See ilina, recipient.
See ILINA, burying place. An inheritance; property falling to one from the death of a person.
An heir; an inheritor of the property of a deceased person.
A burying place.
Street name.
Winter, rainy season. See -ilo. Ua hala ka hoʻoilo, ua mālie, winter is gone, it is calm [trouble is over].
A strong, bitter purgative. (KAM. 64:109)
See ilo 2.
To cause germination or sprouting.
The name of the rainy or wientry months, in distinction from kau, the summer season; also hoilo.
To cause to germinate, sprout. See ilo, pīʻai hoʻoilo.
Winter. See entry below and māuikiʻikiʻi.
See HOILOILO. To guess correctly; to predict; to tell before hand; especially to predict evil.
To rejoice.
See INA.
To sooth as by soft music.
To stir up anger, rouse hate.
To insult, malign, persecute, abuse, dishonor, defame, speak evil. Hōʻino wale, needlessly defame, damn. Hoʻopau hoʻoʻino ʻia, dishonorably discharged [as from the armed services].
To harm, injure, damage.
To give to drink.
See inu, to drink.
See INU. To give drink to; to cause to drink; generally written hoohainu. For the ha, see Gram. § 48.
To show off, boast; to assume an air of superiority, as a child who cuts capers; conceited; affectation, conceit. Cf. ʻoi. Hōʻoio leʻa, to show off with delight.
See ʻoio.
See HOOIA above. To prove; to confirm.
To think much of one’s self; mai ao i na mea hewa—i ka hooio, i ka hookiekie.
To sharpen, make sharp points.
See ʻoiʻoi.
To show off, act superior or aggressive, flaunt; pretentious, obtrusive; upstart. Hōʻoiʻoi ʻole, unobtrusive, modest. Hahaki i ke kānāwai me ka hōʻoiʻoi mai, blatant law breaker.
See OIOI. Assuming; forward; desirous of appearing conspicuous; vain; conceited.
To cut grooves; to sew a quilt so that stitches settle in grooves.
Conceit; to show off.
To make love, court, woo.
See IPO, a mistress. To woo; to court; to solicit the affections of one; applied either to men or women.
To cohabit secretly; to keep a mistress.

To make love, court, woo; love; romantic. Hoʻokela o ka hoʻoipoipo, fantastic love making. Hoʻoipoipo ʻana, courtship. Mele hoʻoipoipo, love song. Ka ʻahaʻaina hoʻoipoipo, revelings. Ka poʻe hoʻoipoipo, whoremongers.
Freq. of hoʻoipo.
To impart mana to a human bone.
To dash down, shatter, break, strike.
To shatter. See kā 1.
See KA, to dash; to strike. To dash; to strike; to cause to kill.
To pay a debt, disburse, avenge (FS 85). Hoʻokaʻa hapa, partial payment.
To cause a rolling, turning.
See kaʻa 1, 4.
See above. The payment of a debt.
The rolling of a wheel.
A throwing anything down a precipice.
See KAA, to roll. To pay out money; to pay a debt.
To roll; to cause to roll, as a wheel.
To turn over often in bed; to toss in distress or sickness.
To throw over or down a precipice, i.e., to roll down it.
To soothe.
Street name.
Kaha hoʻokaʻahua. A straight Z-shaped line written to indicate where two words written as one should be separated, in proofreading. Also kaha hoʻokōā. Cf. kaha kaʻahua.
To communicate. Comb. hoʻo- + kaʻaʻike. See kaʻaʻike. Mākau hoʻokaʻaʻike. Communication skill.
To cause to roll repeatedly. Also hoʻokakaʻa.
Caus/sim of kaʻakaʻa.
See KAAKAA, to open. To open, as the eyes; to cause to open; to cause one to see by opening the eyes.
To cause to roll, i.e., to ride in a carriage. See KAA, a wheel.

example_txt.txt: Hoʻokaʻakaʻawili ihola ʻoia no kona ʻehaʻeha.
He writhed much in his pain.

definitions.dtxt: Redup. of hoʻokaʻawili.
To make a difference; to place one side; to separate; to abstain from; to let alone. See HOOKAOKAO.

example_txt.txt: Hoʻokaʻalia mai ke alo o ka moku iaʻu nei.
Let the front of the island be turned toward me.

definitions.dtxt: Pas/imp. of hoʻokaʻa.
To pass to and fro, to cause to pass. (PPN ta(a)kalo).
To divide equally among, share.
Street name.
To make tame or gentle; to follow after one.
To tell tales; story telling.
To separate, set apart, refrain, abstain from. ʻO ka mea hoʻokaʻaʻokoʻa i ka lāʻau hahau, ʻoia ke aloha ʻole i kāna keiki, he who spares the rod has no love for his son.
Kaa and okoa, other; different. The first orthography is preferable. To make a difference; to place one side; to separate; to abstain from; to let alone. See HOOKAOKAO.
Witty, clever, funny, entertaining, humorous; to pass the time pleasantly; entertaining time.
Street name.

example_txt.txt: to appropriate a sum of money

definitions.dtxt: To separate, distinguish; to cause a division; to keep a distance or distinction; to establish as a separate entity; to set aside, appropriate, sort, segregate, reserve, discriminate, differentiate.
See kaʻawale.
See KAA and WALE, only. To roll off; to separate; to make a space between.
To divide off; to cause a division.
To put away, as in a computer program. Cf. hoʻihoʻi mai, hoʻōki.

example_txt.txt: He hoʻokaʻawale ʻia ka noho ʻana o ka lāhui Pāʻele ma ka ʻaoʻao hema o ʻAmelika ma mua o nā makahiki kanaono.
Blacks in the South lived segregated before the sixties.

definitions.dtxt: To segregate, separate.
Page break, as in computer program. E hoʻokaʻawale i ka ʻaoʻao ma hope o kēia paukū. Insert a page break after this paragraph. Lit. cause a page division.
To take the time (to do something). Lit. set aside time. Also hoʻolilo i ka manawa.
To cause pain; to torture; to cause to twist or writhe; to fondle or pet in ardent love-making.
See KAA and WILI, to twist. To cause to turn or writhe, as in pain; hence, to be in severe pain.
To despise, detest, treat with contempt of scorn; destroy, devastate; to refrain from doing, as due to horror.
To despise. See kae.
Discrimination, prejudice; to discriminate or be prejudiced against. See entries below and paihaʻakei ʻili.

example_txt.txt: Hoʻopiʻi ʻia ka pāʻoihana e kekahi limahana no ka hoʻokae ʻana.
The business was sued by an employee for discrimination.
He pāʻewaʻewa a he hoʻokae kōna manaʻo hoʻoholo ma muli o kōna manaʻo ʻino i ka lāhui o ke kanaka.
His decision was biased and prejudiced because of his negative opinion of the man’s race.

definitions.dtxt: To daub, smudge, soil, smear. Cf. haukaʻe. Hōkaʻe aʻela kuʻu pepa i ka ʻīnika, my paper is smeared by ink.
See KAE, to rub out. To hate; to dislike; to treat contemptuously; to reject.
To blot out; to kill; to destroy; to take away life; ina i hookae mai ke Akua i ke ola o ke kino, if God should take away the life of the body.

example_txt.txt: Mai hoʻokaʻekaʻe wale ʻoe i ka paia.

definitions.dtxt: Redup. of hoʻokaʻe.
To daub over; to paint badly; to defile; to pollute, as food, books, mats, etc.
Misanthropy, hatred of mankind. ʻO ke kanaka hoʻokae kanaka, ʻaʻohe ona hilinaʻi a he inaina hoʻi i nā kānaka. Someone who is misanthropic is distrustful and has malice toward mankind.
Misandry, hatred of males.

Sexism. ʻIke ʻia ka hoʻokae keka ma waena o nā keka ʻelua i kekahi manawa; aia nō i ka pāʻewaʻewa o ka manaʻo o kekahi pūʻulu keka i kekahi. Sexism exists among both sexes at times; it all depends on the bias a group of one sex has toward the other sex. Lit. despise (because of) gender.
To bold, set in boldface type. Comb. hoʻo- + kāʻele. See kāʻele.
See KAEO and KEEO, to be quick tempered. To stir up anger in one; to provoke; to show an evil disposition.
Intensive of the foregoing.
Hōkāʻeuʻeu. To encourage and bestir to action.
Misogyny, hatred of women.
Caus/sim of kaha. to extort.
Caus/sim of kaha.
An extortioner; one who strips people of their property. Hookaha is the result of kuko, lia, iini, etc.
See KAHA, to seize. To extort property from another; to cheat.
To seize upon what is another’s.
To take property with the owner’s knowledge, but without his consent.
Surprising, astonishing; to cause astonishment.

Caus/sim of kahakaha.; to parade back and forth, make a display or exhibition; to show off, act the dandy; to drill, as a fire drill; parade, celebration, exhibition, display, vanity, pomp; superb, showy. Lā hoʻokahakaha, holiday.
Caus/sim of kahakaha. Me ka hoʻokahakaha ʻana i ka lau i ka lima (FOR. 5:663), with the separation of the leaves in the hands.
A display; an exhibition; a celebration; hana iho la ia i hookahakaha no kana poe wahine, he made an exhibition of his wives.
Superb; fine; nice; making a display as a dandy.
To put on many clothes, as children; to make a great show.
To make a great heap of kapas on which to sit or be carried, as in former times.
To make a display; to exhibit finery.
Street name.
To water or irrigate; to cause to flow, discharge, drain.
See kahe, to flow.
A flowing, as of blood.
See KAHE, to spill water. To water; to cause water to flow over land; to cause to flow, as a liquid; to irrigate.
See HEA and KAHEA, to call out. To cause to cry out; to call; to raise the voice in calling.
See HEE and KAHEE, to slip or slide off. To cause to slip away; to slip off; to flow off.
Redup. of hoʻokahe.
Freq. of hookahe. To water, as land; to cause to flow, as water; to wet; to drain, as land.
Irrigation, to irrigate; also same as naʻinaʻi mimi (FS 35).
To shed blood; bloodshed.
See KAHELA, to bend round; to curve. To come along, as the swell of the sea when it comes along the western coast of Hawaii from the south; to flow along, as a high swell of the sea.
See KAHELA and KUHELA. To bend round; to curve, as passing round a cape.
To irrigate. Lit. to irrigate (with) water.

example_txt.txt: E ʻimi kākou ma ka mea e hoʻokahi ai ka manaʻo ʻana.
Let us seek to unite our thoughts into one.
Hoʻokahi kō kāua noho pū ʻana.

definitions.dtxt: One, one only, alone; oneness, separately, single, singular, solitude, sole; together as a unit, at the same time; to make one, unite; to be similar; same; a, an.

definitions.der: [PPN tafi, but cf. Fijian tasi, to escrape]
definitions.dtxt: Caus/sim of kahi.
See kahi 1.
A oneness; a unity; a being only one.
One; only one, in distinction from many.
Art. One of the semi-definite articles; a; an; one; only one. Gram. § 63, 65, 3.
See KAHI, one. To be or cause to be one; to divide by individuals.
To make one, i.e., to resemble; to be similar or like something else. E imi kakou ma ka mea e hookahi ai ka manao ana, let us seek to unite our thoughts into one.
To attend to one thing; to make one out of many.
Street name.
To entrap, ensnare, entangle, etc.
See KAHI, to rub; to comb. To anoint; to daub over.
To rub; to polish.
To comb.
Frequentative of the above.
To think, act, speak in the old way; to speak of old times; to cling to old ways; old-fashioned; maturity. He wahine hoʻokahiko, an old-fashioned woman.
See KAHIKO, to be old. To return to conversation and manners of ancient times; to talk of former times; to imitate ancient manners.
To dress someone in finery to adorn, decorate, deck, trim, array; to wear fine clothes.
Caus/sim of kāhikohiko.
Caus/sim of kāhinu.
Caus/sim of kāhiō.
See HIO, to lean over. To cause to lean over a little.
To be a little intoxicated so as to stagger some.
To mix together two ingredients, as flour and water, spittle and earth.
To cause to hurry; to speed, hurry.
Redup. of hoʻokāholo, to exercise, as a horse; to practice racing; skittering in fishing. E hoʻokāholoholo ana ua wahi puaʻa nei, this little pig hurried.
To act as a kahu; to appoint a kahu. Mea hoʻokahu ʻia, ward, beneficiary of an estate.
To make a fire for cooking in the oven; to act as kahu.
Street name.

To lay a foundation, establish, found; to camp or be stationed, as soldiers; to settle down and develop a place, as homesteaders. Hoʻokahua ka noʻonoʻo, settle down to a task with determination to see it through. Koʻu noho aliʻi i hoʻokahua ʻia maluna o kahi puʻuʻ pele, my kingdom established on a lava hill.
See kahua.
Lauana hoʻokahua. Settlement pattern, in geography.
Caus/sim of kahuli.
See kahuli, overthrow.
See HULI and KAHULI, to turn; to change. To change the outward form of a thing; to turn over; to turn upside down; to overthrow.
Caus/sim of kāhuli. ʻO Pāʻao ka mea nāna i hoʻokāhuli i ka lāhui Hawaiʻi nei ma ka hoʻomana kiʻi (Kep. 21), Pāʻao was the one who converted the Hawaiian people to idol worship.
Revolulion, as against a government. Kaua hoʻokahuli aupuni. Revolutionary war.
Frequentative of hoʻokahuli.
To cause to be a kahuna or pretend to be one; to ordain or train as a kahuna.
See KAHUNA, a professional man. To act in any profession; to act the artisan, the priest, the doctor, etc.
See HUNA, a small particle. To be little, small or fine. See HUNAHUNA.
See KAI, to displace. To waste; to destroy; to put away.
To dilute. Comb. hoʻo- + kaiaka. Cf. paʻipaʻi.
To harden.
To be hard in a bargain; to be close; to be stingy.
To claim a kaikaina relationship; to act as a kaikaina, to address and treat as kaikaina, as from affection.
To claim a kaikuaʻana relationship, to act as a kaikuaʻana, to address and treat as kaikuaʻana; to address a kaikaina as kaikuaʻanaas a means of showing great respect.
To claim a kuahine relationship; to address and treat as a kaikuahine, as from affection.
To claim a kaikunāne relationship, to act as a kaikunāne; to address and treat as kaikunāne, as from affection.
To tug and pull as though to snatch, but not with great force, as in playing with a kitten; to cause a snatching, etc.
To put in order, sequence. Comb. hoʻo- + kaʻina. Cf. hoʻolaukaʻi. See entries below. Hoʻokaʻina pīʻāpā. To alphabetize, put in alphabetical order.
To prioritize, set priorities. Cf. hoʻomakakoho. See makakoho.
To sequence ideas, as in a composition.
To rank, as from small to large. Lit. put ranks in sequence. See pae.
To register (someone for something). Comb. hoʻo- + kāinoa. See kāinoa. Hoʻokāinoa poʻe koho pāloka. To register voters for an election.
To take possession (referring to an action of a god). E ala e hoʻokainuʻu, kaiao (hula altar prayer), rise, take possession of the altar, bring light.
See KA, to dash; strike. To break up, as wood for fuel (anciently Hawaiians had no axes for cutting fuel.)
To strike against; to dash; to break up fine.
To cause to turn, roll, etc.; to turn somersaults or cartwheels.
The dark involving of clouds before a storm; the rolling together of clouds; a thick atmosphere before a storm.
See KAA, wheel. To turn, as a wheel; to turn round.
Redup. of hoʻokaʻawale.
See KAHA, to write; to scratch. To strike; to dash against.
To pierce, as on coming in contact like two cocks in fighting; to strike with spurs, as a cock.
To scratch; to make marks.
E hoopopololei, e hooinainau, e hookawowo.
To parade, as Lahaina-Luna students. (FOR. 6:531)
To lead, take along.
See KALA, rough. To make rough; to have many protuberances; to be rough with sharp points.
To sharpen; to grind on a stone.
To make soft or spongy; to be soft; to be flexible, like the comb of a cock.
Caus/sim of kakane.
To make noises.
To have the itch; to be sore. See MEAU.
Caus/sim of kakano.
To stretch forth, to make rigid; to oppress; to flex muscles, as in desire to show off one’s strength.
To speak kake; to speak unclearly. Cf. holokake, hōkake.
Caus/sim of kake.; to disturb.
To mix up the order, jumble. Lit. disturb (the) order.
Muddy; dirty; pehea ia wahi, maikai anei? Aole, he hookakekake wale no.
To wipe or wash imperfectly or slovenly, as a table or dishes; in washing clothes when one daubs on soap and hardly washes it off, it is said, he hookakekake kau hana ana, aole pau ka lepo.
To mix medicine with food in order to take it.
To daub or paint over carelessly, as in coloring a map.
To blot over.
Caus/sim of kākoʻo.
Street name.
To sharpen, grind (so called because things were formerly sharpened by rubbing against a rough surface); sharpener; to speak roughly or harshly. Hunahuna hoʻokala, chips.
Caus/sim of kala.
See kala 1, 4.
See KALA, rough. To sharpen; to grind, i.e., to rub on a stone for sharpening; to grind, as a tool.
To cause to clear; to become clear.
See KALAE, clear sky. To clear off, as clouds after a rain; to open, as the clouds that the sky may appear; to be clear, as the sky.
Same as above. Hoʻokalahala akula ʻo ʻAʻalona no lākou, i mea e huikala ai iā lākou, Aaron made an atonement for them to cleanse them.
See KALAHALA, to pardon sin. To cause to pardon sin; to make an atonement.
Same as hoʻokāluli, to sway.
Caus/sim of kālai.
See KALAI, to hew. To cause to hew; to cut, as wood or stones into some shape.
To unsmooth, as in computer program. Lit. cause (to be) rough. Cf. hoʻolaumania.
Caus/sim of kalakalai.
See the above. To cut off; to smooth, as the inside of a canoe.
Magic; to do wondrous acts; a magician, enchanter, witchcraft; extraordinary fisherman, elusive thief. He ikaika hoʻokalakupua, extraordinary or supernatural strength. See kupua.
See kalakupua.
To lie in wait; to ambuscade for the purpose of robbery; to act the part of spies.
To entrap one in his words.
To observe or watch slily as one plots mischief.
Magic, as supernatural or enchanted. Cf. pāhaʻohuna.
Caus/sim of kalalī.; to hurry.
See KALALI. To go quickly and straightforward.
Same as hoʻokananeʻo.
To unencrypt, as a code or computer data. Lit. undo (a) code. See hoʻopāʻālua, pāʻālua.
To make liquid (less used than hoʻokakale).
To make watery or thin; to lie, deceive; soft, spongy, sagging.
Lying; deceitful; treacherous.
To cause to support; stress. See hilinaʻi. Ka hoʻokālele ʻana o ka leo maluna o kekahi hua ʻōlelo, the stress of the voice on certain words.
To cause to wait, delay; lingering, slow, as a disease.
See kali, to wait.
See KALI, to delay. To cause to wait; to wait; to delay; to wait for something.
To cause death; to have the appearance of death.
Caus/sim of kālilolilo.
See KALILO. To draw near to death; to have the last symptoms of death; to die.
To pretend to droop, flirt, etc.; to cause drooping.
To bend; to vibrate, as a leaf in the wind.
To ogle; to bend and twist, as a fop or a vain woman; e hookaluhi waiokila.
To cause to bend and sway.

To adopt a child or adult one loves, but for whom one might not have the exclusive care. (An older adult of either sex might be adopted thus. A child so adopted, termed keiki hoʻokama, is somewhat comparable to a godchild. An adult so adopted might be called kaikuaʻana hoʻokama, kaikaina hoʻokama, kaikuahine hoʻokama, kaikunāne hoʻokama.) Cf. hānai, luhi.
An adopted child.
See KAMA, a child. To adopt, as a child; to make the child of another one’s own.
To put on shoes, furnish shoes.
To shoe; to furnish with shoes or sandals.
To become acquainted with. E hoʻokamaʻāina! Make yourself at home [said to strangers].
Caus/sim od kāmaʻe.
To be or do something wonderful; to take a new and more splendid form.
See KAMAHAO. To be or do something wonderful; to be transformed; to take a new form, especially a more splendid one.
To talk and lead up to the subject one wishes to discuss.
Male homosexuality; to practice such. (Malo 67, Emerson note.)
As a prostitute, living in a state of prostitution; he hookamaka kekahi mea nui ma kahi alii.
definitions.notes: Note: This may be an erroneous orthography for hookamakama.

definitions.dtxt: To prostitute; prostitute, prostitution, concubine. Lit. to cause children.
See kamakama.
See KAMAKAMA. To prostitute one’s wife or daughter for pay; to prostitute one’s self for money; to make one a prostitute; to behave lasciviously.
To ask forgiveness, to seek restoration of friendship.
See HOOMAKA, to begin. To prepare the way for doing a thing; to begin to do a thing.
To make a favorite of a person, to treat with indulgence, to pamper, spoil, or lavish with favors; to put on finicky airs and mannerisms.

See KAMALANI. To make one a favorite, especially one that appears unworthy to every one else except the chief; to treat, as a doting parent a disobedient or mischievous child; to lavish favors on a bad child.
Childish.
To act the hypocrite; to deal falsely, to disguise oneself, to pretend, be insecure; hypocrite; sham. Hoʻokamani ʻole, honestly, unfeigned.
See kamani 2.
A hypocrite.
Hypocrisy; guile.
To have a very good external appearance, as any substance, but internally worthless.
Applied to persons, to be deceitful; to act the hypocrite; to make hypocritical pretensions; to be a worthless person under a pleasant exterior.
Sullen, cross, resentful, hostile, uncivil. Cf. ʻāaniha, niha, maniha.
See KAMANIHA, to be rude. To be rude; to be rough; to be wild; to be unsocial.
Caus/sim of kāmau. to eat, as ʻinamona relish (FOR. 5:715). E hoʻokāmau mai ʻoe, add a little more.
Caus/sim of kāmau.
Same as above.
Caus/sim of kāmoku.
Caus/sim of kanaaho.
Small, depressed, stunted, humble, cautious, moderate; to lessen.
See KANAHAI, to decrease. To be small; to be stinted; to make small; to make less; to reduce in size; to humble somewhat. See next word.
To be small; to be depressed; to make less.
Street name.
To drive or urge forward, accelerate, hurry, quicken.
To drive or urge forward; to accelerate movement; to hurry; to quicken.
To rise up, as a whale’s back in the water; bent, humpbacked, disobedient; bend, crook.
See KANAHUA, crooked; stoop-shouldered. To bend upwards, as a crooked rafter.
To rise above water, as a whale’s back.
To bend; to crook; to be humpbacked.
Conceited, vain, overbearing.

Manly, human, courageous; to become a servant or helper; to assume human shape, as a child in the womb. See hoʻokanaka makua. E hoʻokanaka, be a man. E hoʻokanaka ʻoukou, ʻaʻole e hoʻonāwaliwali kō ʻoukou mau lima, be strong, let your hands not be weak.
See KANAKA, a man. To be or act like a man; to be brave; to be manly; to act the part of a brave man.
To act as an adult, to act mature. Koʻu hoʻokanaka makua ʻana, my coming of age.
See KANAKAMAKUA. The state of being mature, as a young person of either sex; being grown up. Laieik. 28.
To quicken; to hasten; to urge on. See HOOKANAHE.
Caus/sim of kanaleʻo.
To try hard to walk straightly, as one who wishes to disguise his drunkenness.
To cause doubt. Hoʻokānalua ʻole ʻia ʻo kona ʻoiaʻiʻo, there is no cause to doubt its truth.
See KANALUA, to be in doubt. To be in doubt; to hesitate; to be fearful.
To stalk about in a proud swinging manner.

To disregard, as instruction, warning, danger, careless of danger, indifference to discomfort or health. See ex., puʻumake. Hoʻokananeʻo hoʻi ka hele i ka pō, ā laʻa lā i ke anu, insisting on going out at night against advice, then got a cold.
To cause sulkiness; dull of hearing.
In doubt; to hesitate.
Same as hoʻokanahē.
To push forward; to urge on; to quicken; to hasten in doing a thing. See KANAHE.
Conceited, feeling that one is superior to everybody else. Cf. ʻoi, best.

To impose a law, especially to vow not to associate with certain persons or places until certain conditions are fulfilled. Hoʻokānāwai akula ia i kona wahi i hele ai, ʻaʻole e hele hou; hoʻokānāwai akula i nā makamaka, he made a vow not to go again to that place; he made a rule not to associate with the friends.

See KANAWAI, law, etc. To be enraged at; to set off from one in anger; to dislike one who has been a friend; hookanawai aku la ia i kona wahi i hele ai, aole e hele hou; hookanawai aku la i na makamaka.

To behave as a male; masculine; to adopt a man as a platonic friend, said of a woman (the relationship cements friendship between the relatives of both participants); to offer to become husband or sweetheart. Cf. hoʻowahine. Ua hoʻokāne aku nei mākou nāu (FOR. 4:59), we have obtained a husband for you.
To make a special friend of a man; applied only to a woman.
To keep a lodging house.
To cause loss of appetite.
Street name.
To play. See kani, sound.
See KANI, to make a musical sound. To sing; to sing for joy; to make a musical sound.
To ring a bell; to play on an instrument of music.
See hao hoʻokani, mīkini hoʻokani pāleo, mīkini lola.
Redup. of hoʻokani; also a diminutive: ka hoʻokanikani mai o kēia leo ʻūlili liʻiliʻi (ka uē keiki), the sobbing of the voice of the small tattler bird (a child’s cry).
See hoʻokani. To play the ukeke; to strike on anything to make a sound.
To sing often.
To make a noise, as a multitude of voices and instruments preparatory to a mokomoko or boxing match; a noho malie na kanaka, alaila, hookanikani pihe mai, penei.
Street name.
To make a great noise, as in an assembly for the hula and other assemblies; alaila, hookanipihe mai kela aoao o ka aha.
Street name.
To harden; to form a tuber, as of sweet potato. Cf. kakano.
See kano 1, and -kano.
See KANO. Haughtiness; pride; self sufficiency.
See KANO, to be proud. To be proud; to be lofty in demeanor; to be haughty.
To abstain from; to let alone; to spare; to treat with affection.
To cause to plant or bury.
To freeze dry. Comb. hoʻo- + kaʻohau. See kaʻohau.
To progress, go ahead, improve, better; progressive.
See KAOKAO. To put one’s self forward; to be prominent among many others; makemake no oia e hookaokao ia ia. Laieik. 91.
To separate from others, keep away, abstain.
To add or feign pressing.
To cause to turn off, push aside, parry, thrust away, refute an argument.
See KAPAE, to pervert. To turn off; to push aside; to parry off; to render ineffectual, as an argument.
To conceal under one’s kapa.
To crackle, roar, etc.
To loosen, set askew; to tilt, as a canoe; to sit or loosen the clothing so as to cause indecent exposure.
Putting on a dress and yet being exposed, an incentive to lewdness; eia kekahi mea e moekolohe ai, o ka hoohiehie a o ka hookapeke.
See KAPEKE, to be out of joint. To unloose; to uncover; to send forth.
To lay aside, as property; to conceal.
To take off; to remove, as the cover of a calabash; hookapeke i ka waiwai, to lay aside property; hookapeke i ka poi, to take off the cover; hookapeke i ka waa, to conceal the canoe.
Caus/sim of kāpekepeke.
See hoʻokapeke and kāpekepeke.
Caus/sim of kāpili.
To rotate, revolve, as in a hula.
See KAPU, prohibition. To prohibit; to forbid; to put under an interdict.
To consecrate; to make sacred; to set aside for a particular use.
Same as above; to feed an eel; to nurse or care for a child or person. Fig. Clever, smart. Mai puni mai nā hoʻokāpuhi, don't be taken in by smart, wily folk.
A nurse of a king’s or a chief’s child; e na haumana, ame na kumu, ame na hookapuhi, ame na kahu.
definitions.notes: Note: This is said to be a word peculiar to Oahu.

definitions.dtxt: The kahu of an animal, as the master or owner of a dog; e imi ma ka hanuhanu ana ka ka ilio e loaa'i ka hookapuhi, to seek like the dog’s smelling to find the master.
To take care, as the kahu or nurse of a chief’s child; applied only to chiefs.
To impose a taboo, especially on something not previously taboo; to pretend a taboo that was not existent; to extol, praise, glorify. (PPN taputapu).
See KAPU. Intensive and frequentative of the foregoing.
To ripen, fatten.
To put on, place on, lay on, as responsibility; to happen, come to pass. Hoʻokau hiamoe, to fall asleeep.
See KAU, to hang or put up. To put up upon; to go up; to place one thing upon another; e hookau hiamoe, to fall asleep. Laieik. 143.
To burden with work, make a servant of, enslave; to act as servant or outcast.
Kau and ahe, light, gentle, as a light breeze. To fly softly or gently, like a kite.
To hover; to fly softly, gently, continuously, at the same speed.
To balance something. Hiki iā ʻoe ke hoʻokaualewa i kēnā peni ma kou manamana lima? Can you balance that pen on your finger? Comb. hoʻo- + kaualewa. Cf. kaualewa.
To compensate, counterbalance. Comb. hoʻo- + kauapono. Cf. uku pānaʻi. See kauapono. ʻŌnaehana hoʻokauapono. Balancing mechanism, in biology.
To entangle.

To cause pregnancy; gestation; pregnancy sickness; pregnancy craving [thought to indicate the character of the child in the womb]. Makemake ʻoia i ka heʻe, he hoʻokauhua paha, she craves octopus, probably because of her pregnancy. I hoʻokauhua i ke kōlea, no kahiki ana ke keiki, with a pregnancy craving for plover, the child will be a traveler.
See KAUHUA. The forming or growing state of the young in the womb. Anat. 2.
To place, put, etc.
See above. The gathering of clouds before a rain regarded as a sign of foul weather.
See KAU, to put upon. To put up; to ascend upon; to cause to arise; to lift up a thing, as a child in putting him on a horse.
To gather, as clouds before a rain.
To cause delay, linger.
See the foregoing. To wait; to procrastinate.
To cause to walk with a cane; to walk thus. Ua loaʻa iā ʻAlamila ke kuleana e hoʻokaukoʻo aku ai maluna ona i nā lawelawe kōkua ʻana, Almira obtained the right to depend on him for serving help.
Street name.
To make famous; to spread a report concerning a person or thing.
See KAULANA, to be renowned. To make a person or event known as famous; to send abroad a report concerning a person or thing; to make famous.

To justify, as type in printing. Comb. hoʻokau + lihi. Cf. hoʻokauwaena, kaulihi. Hoʻokaulihi hema. To justify left. Hoʻokaulihi ʻākau. To justify right. Hoʻokaulihi like. To justify full. Kaha hoʻokaulihi. Two vertical lines written to the left of lines of print to indicate that the left margin should be justified, in proofreading.
Street name.
To equalize, balance. Hoʻokaulike hoʻokaʻa, equalization of payments.
See kaulike, equality.
To cause delay, etc.
See KAULUA, to be slack. To procrastinate; to delay; to detain; to be slow in obeying a command.
To be in doubt; to hesitate about doing a thing; to postpone a work.
Caus/sim of kauluwela.
To burden, load down, laden. Fig. To oppress, cause sadness or grief; sorrowful, woeful, sorry, depressed, oppressive, burdensome. Mea hoʻokaumaha moku, ballast. Mai hoʻokaumaha, don't worry.
See KAUMAHA. To lay a burden upon one; to be hard upon; to trouble; to oppress.
Caus/sim of kaunu.
To cause to be dragged; to prolong vowels in chanting.
To cause a separation, barrier; to disown, disinherit.
Caus/sim of kaupalena.
See KAUWA, a servant. To make a servant of; to cause one to serve or to be a servant; to act in the capacity of a servant.
To center justify. Ua hoʻokauwaena ʻia ka ʻaoʻao mua o kēia palapala. The first page of this document is center justified. Comb. hoʻo- + kauwaena. Cf. hoʻokaulihi, kauwaena.
Hard service; cruel bondage.
See KAUWA and KUAPAA, to make one’s back rough. To serve with rigor; to act under, and live in hard bondage.
Horror, as stories or movies. Comb. hoʻokau + weli. Kiʻiʻoniʻoni hoʻokauweli. Horror movie.
See KAUOWO and KAUWOWO, to branch out and spread, as vines. To cause to grow and increase, as vines or vegetables of rapid growth; to grow thriftily, as vines or plants.
To cause to multiply, as a people.
To tab, as on a computer or typewriter. Comb. hoʻo- + kāwāholo. Cf. kīpoʻo. See kāwāholo.
To hydrolyze. Comb. hoʻo- + kā + wai + -hia. Ka hoʻokāwaihia ʻana. Hydrolysis.
To make sparse; to eat sparingly; to talk unintelligibly.
To wipe, pretend to wipe.
Caus/sim of kāwili.
See KAAWILI and KAWILI, to twist. To twist; to turn.
To roar, as a wind or waterfall. Cf. wōwō, roar.
Caus/sim of kawowo.
See KAWOWO 5, to roar. To make a slight rumbling noise, as by moving the feet, drumming with the fingers, etc.; to rustle, as leaves in the wind; to roar, as a waterfall.

To crowd, elbow, push aside, jostle, struggle, oppress, shun, scorn, protest. Fig. To beset with difficulties. Hoʻokē ʻai, to fast. Hoʻokē ā maka, to favor some at the expense of others, as relatives. Hoʻokē ihu, to blow the nose. Nā weliweli hoʻokē, oppressive terrors. Kaʻula i ka hoʻokē a nā manu (saying), Kaʻula [Islet] is crowded with birds [of any crowded place].
To crowd. See kē 1.
A struggling against difficulty; an urging on.
See KE, to force; to compel. To crowd together, as at the door of a house (as formerly); to elbow; to edge on by degrees.
To get possession in a foreign couentry without permission; applied to many foreigners who have crowded themselves in; to push aside any person or thing that is in the way.
To get one into difficulty; to struggle against opposition.
To abstain from; to let alone; to leave untouched.
To blow the nose.
To blow one’s nose. Also hūkē.
To cross, block, obstruct, hinder.
Hooke and ai, food. To abstain from food; to fast.
Selfish, ungracious, as one eating in the presence of others; partial; partiality.

To make a turn, as in cutting paper or cloth; to turn, as in walking; to bend, form an angle. Hoʻokeʻe i ka wāwae, to walk by crossing the feet one in front of the other, as in some kinds of square dancing.
To shun, slight, avoid. Cf. kē 1.
Redup. of hoʻokeʻe; zigzag, angular; zigzag lines, as in a mat motif. Same as kīkeʻekeʻe.
See KEKEE, crooked. To make crooked; to crook; to bend.
To do wrong; to pervert right.
To behave thus.
See KEEO, to be angry. To be quickly angry; to be wrathful; to be quick tempered.
Street name.
To cause height, pride, boasting, etc. Same as keha.
See KEHA 3, to be puffed up. To be puffed up; to be proud; to be self glorious.
To act proudly; to cause pride.
See above and KEHA. To be proud; to be high minded; to imitate a chief in manners and dignity.
Caus/sim of kei.
To set one’s self above others literally; to take a higher seat; morally, to be proud; to be self exalted; alaila, hookei iho la ke kahuna nui nana i kai ka aha.
Caus/sim of keikei.
See KEI, to glory; to boast. To honor one’s self; to be proud of one’s skill at any business; to be vainglorious; to think much of one’s self.
Caus/sim of kekē.
Same as haʻakekē
See kēkē.
Area in upper Kohanaiki, Kona, Hawaiʻi. See Maiʻaloa.
To crook, bend, twist out of shape, pervert.
Crooked; warped; bent, naturally or morally.
Displeased; offended at any neglect.
See KEEKEE, crooked. To crook; to bend; to pervert; to spurn; to make crooked.
Caus/sim of keku.
Street name.
To outdo, surpass, excel, exceed; to show off, try to excel, show preference; higher, superior, vain.
The name of a month.
See KELA, to extend beyond. To exceed; to go beyond; to be higher; to be more.

To brag, show off, flaunt, display; disrespectful, overbearing, conceited. Nā hana hoʻokelakela, extravagant display. Ua hoʻokelakela ka mea hewa i ka makemake o kona naʻau, the wicked one boasts of his heart’s desire.
Street name.
Street name.
See kele, watery, and kele, to sail.
Same as hoʻokelekele.
A steerer of a canoe. Laieik. 45. See HOOKELEWAA.
See KELE, to slip; to slide along. To sail, as the master of a ship or canoe.
To direct or steer a ship or canoe; to hold the helm.
To praise; to extol.
See entries below and luna hoʻokele, pahu hoʻokele.
Redup. of hoʻokele; to steer, navigate or sail frequently; to manage; to cast, as for fish. Hoʻokelekele kaʻa, to drive a car; chauffeur.
To make muddy; to sprinkle; soak material, as pandanus leaves, in water to make pliable for plaiting; to feed, fatten, especially with soft food or liquids.
See KELE, to slip, etc. To slip or slide easily.
To sail about for pleasure in a canoe or boat.
To bathe a child near dead with famine.
To scatter water; to wet mats; e hookelekele i ka moena.
Wayfinding; to wayfind. Lit. sail (a) canoe. Also kele moana.
The helmsman of a canoe.
To use much water in mixing or pounding poi, or in irritation.
Economy. Ikaika ka hoʻokele waiwai ʻana o ka ʻāina. The couentry’s economy is strong. Lit. conduct financial business. Cf. hoʻomohala waiwai, kālaihoʻokele waiwai. See entries below.

Command economy, i.e., an economic system in which the government controls the factors of production and makes the basic economic decisions. Lit. economy (with) one authority. Cf. hoʻokele waiwai kū lanakila.

To assimilate. He hoʻokemua ka nui o ka poʻe komoneʻe o kekahi ʻāina iā lākou iho i ka noho ʻana o kō ia ʻāina. Most immigrants to a couentry assimilate themselves into the lifestyle of that counrty. Comb. hoʻo- + kemua. See kemua.
Street name.
To satisfy thirst.
Land section, village, elementary school, and beach park, Hōnaunau qd., Kona, Hawaiʻi. (For a song, see Elbert and Mahoe 68-69)
To compel, order.
To whiten bleach.
A long calabash.
See KEO, white. To make white; to whiten.
To whiten.
See KEO, white. To cause whiteness; to be white.
Gentlemanly conduct or etiquette; to act as a gentleman. He mau lula no ka hoʻokeonimana ʻana, rules for gentlemanly etiquette.
To cut obliquely, snap, tear, rend.
See kepa.
See KEPA, to snatch at. To snap or snatch at with the teeth; to prick like a spur.
To act like or mimic Japanese.
To act like or mimic Spaniards or Spanish.
See KEU, a remainder. To have over and above; to have or make a remainder.
Caus/sim of kī.; to cause to shoot; to sick on, as a dog; to make a cat spit; to snort; emitted.
See KI, to shoot, and HOOKIKI. To spill; to drop.
To shoot a gun.
See oki, to stop.
To cancel, as a computer function. Cf. hoʻihoʻi mai, hoʻokaʻawale.

example_txt.txt: E hoʻōki i ke paʻi ʻana.
cloture, i.e., a method of ending debate and causing an immediate vote to be taken, as in a legislature

definitions.dtxt: To pretend to cut short, to cause to cut, cut, divorce, dismiss, cancel, excommunicate.
See ʻoki, to cut.
To post a watch.
Redup. of hoʻokio.
Caus/sim of kiawe.
Caus/sim of kiʻe.
See KIE, high. To lift up; to be high. See KIEKIE.
See KIEI, to look sharply. To cause to peep; to look slily at.
Street name.
To elevate, promote, lift up; proud, lording it over others, overbearing, disrespectful or disobedient to seniors, vain; promotion, elevation, conceit.
See kiʻekiʻe, height.
Pride; haughtiness; overbearing conduct.
See KIE and KIEKIE, to be high. To elevate; to lift up.
To be proud; to be high minded; to lord it over another.
Caus/sim of kīhā.
See KIHE, to sneeze. To cause to sneeze.
To make a corner by overlapping, as in plaiting; to fold partially over; to turn aside, make a corner.
To defend off; to reproach; to persecute; to put one under a law.
To branch out, make corners, make irregular.
See KIHI, corner; edge, etc. To branch out; to make many corners; to make the sides of a figure irregular.
To send, have sent for; to take away.
Var. of hōkiʻi, thin, wasted.
Thinness of flesh; consumption. Leanness.
Thin; lean in flesh.
Close; parsimonious.
To grow thin in flesh; to dissolve; to disappear.
See KII, to go after. To cause to go for a thing; to cause to fetch; to go after; to take hold of; to seize.
To cause to fetch, fetch, take hold of, seize, get.
To swell out, as the breast; as the stomach; to rise up.
Ready with a rude retort.
To go zigzag.
Caus/sim of kīkeʻekeʻe.
To cause to flow, pour, etc. Hoʻokikī kānāwai, to enforce the law.
Caus/sim of kīkī.
See kīkī.
See HOOKI, to spill. To spill; to drop, as water; to squirt or throw water, as a fire-engine.
Same as hoʻokiʻekiʻe.

example_txt.txt: to sit up, as a dog; to sit leaning back

definitions.dtxt: Caus/sim of kīkiʻi.
See hoʻokiʻikiʻi.
To cause to tilt, as the camera when filming a movie or video production.
Redup. of hoʻokina.
See KINA and KIKINA, to send one on an errand. To send on an errand with dispatch; to command; to order; to hurry.
To scold; to be angry.
To leave suddenly, as in a great hurry.
See KINO, body, and HOOKINO. To make or cause a body; to embody.
To hatch.
Caus/sim of kīlepa.
Street name.
To rain gently.
Caus/sim of kilihune. He wahi lā hoʻokilihune ua kēia, this is just a day of slight showers.
Caus/sim of kilo.
See KILO and HAKILO, to look earnestly. To spy; to evesdrop or overhear; to act as a spy upon those who do wrong; e hookilo i ka hewa.
To watch, as one who is doing wrong; to watch slily.
To grow thin and spare; to waste away, as one in the consumption; hookilo kino ole, wiwi.
To feign throwing; to cause to throw; to attract someone’s attention by throwing something at him, as a stone, leaf, flower.
Caus/sim of kīmō.
See KIMO, to strike. To seize; to catch up; to grasp, as the hand does a stone.
To be oppressed; to be weighed down; to be weary; to be near fainting.
Street name.
See kina.
See KINA, to urge on. To make one heavy or sad; to oppress; to make weary; to put one burden on after another; to add one command after another.
To urge one to do a thing; to compel to do it; malia i hookina ai kuu kane ia'u i ka inu awa, perhaps my husband will compel me to drink awa. Laieik. 208.
To pour down fast. as rain.
To cause defect, disaster, etc.
See kīnā, blemish.
Redup. of hoʻokina. Ka ua hoʻokinakina, the continuous rain.
Frequentative of kina.
To take shape, embody; to develop, as a puny infant; to take form, as a spirit.
See kino, body.
See KINO, body. To embody; to give body, form or solidity to a thing; to take a shape; hookino ai ka honua, he gave the earth a body or shape. See HOOKIKINO.
To take a body; to take shape; to embody, as a shapeless mass; hookino ka honua, the earth took shape (from chaos.)
To adorn, add color. Mea hoʻokīnohinohi, decorations.
Caus/sim of kīnohi.
Caus/sim of kino wailua. (FOR. 6:452)
To spread out, project.
Same as hōkio, a whistle.
See KIO, a pool; a puddle. To spread out; to enlarge.
To assemble together, as water in a lake or pond.
To gather or settle, as water in a lake or pond; to cease flowing, of menstruation. Lua hoʻokiʻo wai, cistern. Luawai hoʻokiʻo, reservoir.
Same as hoʻokiʻo.

chants.chtran: It is rain, rain-drops for the buds … water settling on the kikawaiō fern.
chants.chtxt: He ua nō, he kulu ua no ka liko … ke hoʻokiʻoa i nā kikawaiō.

definitions.dtxt: See KIOKIO, to play on a pipe. To pipe; to play on, as a fife; to play on any wind instrument.
Street name.
Street name.
To entertain, treat hospitably; hospitable; hospitality.
To entertain. See kipa.
Disposed to entertain strangers; kanaka hookipa, a man liberal in entertaining strangers; wahine hookipa.
See KIPA, to turn aside. To turn in to lodge.
To entertain with hospitality; to invite to enter one’s house.
See lumi hoʻokipa.
Beach park and surfing area (Finney, 1959a:108) near Pāʻia, Maui; surfing areas here are known as Hoʻokipa Lefts and Rights. Way. Kaimukī, Honolulu.
Caus/sim of kīpehi.
To foment or act in revolt; rebellious.
See kipi, rebellion.
See KIPI, rebel. Rebelliously; treacherously.
To enrich or fertilize, as soil.
Caus/sim of kīpupū.
To curve, bend; to stagger, etc.
See KIWI, to crook. To crook or bend, as a horn.
To pull along; to fall down.
To urbanize. See kiwikā.
Caus/sim of kiwikiwi.
See KIWI above. To pull along; to seize hold of; to fatigue.
To hook on to; to crook.
Street name.

example_txt.txt: hoʻokō hana mamua o ka leʻaleʻa
ka puke o ka pule ʻana a me ka ho ʻokō ʻana
the book of prayers and the administration [of the sacrament]

definitions.dtxt: Executive; to fulfill; to carry out, as a contract; to enforce, execute, confirm, construe, interpret, decree; to award, as land; to probate, perform, satisfy; to transact, accomplish; to cause a conception; confirmation, award.
See kō, to fulfill.
See Ko, to fulfill. To fulfill; to carry out, as a contract; to fulfill, as an agreement or promise.

example_txt.txt: operator, as a sign in a computer mathematical operation

definitions.dtxt: See palapala hoʻokō. Cf. pākō.
To act as a soldier; to cause to be a soldier.
Brave; to cause bravery.
See KOA, a soldier. To act the soldier; to be brave; to be strong; to be fearless.

Kaha hoʻokōā. A straight Z-shaped line written to indicate where two words written as one should be separated, in proofreading. Also kaha hoʻokaʻahua. Pihi hoʻokōā. Space bar, on typewriter or computer keyboard, variant term (preceded by ke). Also pihi kaʻahua.
To make different, to set apart, distinguish, separate, cause to differ, discriminate. Cf. hoʻokaʻaʻokoʻa.
For hoookoa. See OKOA, another. To make another.
To divide; to distinguish; to separate.
To whirl; to turn round.
To put off; to postpone.
Caus/sim of koʻakoʻa.
To set spacing, as single- or double-space on a typewriter. Comb. hoʻo- + koana. See koana, kaʻahua.
To settle, as dregs. Fig. To put one’s mind on a thing, concentrate upon.
Street name.
To save, reserve for later use, cause a remainder.
To save. See koe, to remain.
See KOE, remainder. To cause some to remain; to be over and above; to be left after some are taken; to reserve; to set aside.
To cache, as a computer function.

example_txt.txt: This disk has been cached. See ahu hoʻokoe.

definitions.dtxt: To cause heat. Fig. To distress. Hoʻokōʻehaʻeha nohoʻi ka hana a keiki i ka makua, how childish actions distress the parents.
To make cold; to chill.
See KOEKOE, cold. To cause to be cold; to be cold and wet; to be chilly.
Caus/sim of koʻele.
Caus/sim of koene.; to endeavor to walk in spite of weakness; mentally at rest after mental agitation, calmed. Hoʻokoene kāna hele ʻana, he goes slowly, cautiously.
See KOENE, shelter; rest. To cause rest; to cause quietness; to be free from trouble.
To strip bare or naked.
To fold pandanus matting to form a corner; to form a crease, groove, etc.
Caus/sim of kōheo.
Caus/sim of kōhi. Also haʻakōhi.
To choose, elect, appoint.
To rejoice at the overthrow of one’s enemy; to be glad at his discomfiture. See HOONAIKOLA and AIKOLA.

To assume a likeness to; to presume to; to make advances, perhaps hypocritically; to take a fancy to; to have a crush on; presumption, pretense. Mea hoʻokohu, thing that matches, accessories. Nānā aku ʻoe i ka hoʻokohu o mea iā Pole, see how so-and-so is infatuated with Pole. ʻAʻole hoʻi i ka hoʻokohu o ka makeʻe waiwai, nor a pretense of covetousness. Hoʻokohu ka ua i uka, how fit and pleasing is the rain of the uplands.
