See kohu, resemblance, and -kohu.
A favorite or chosen one; one appointed first to a post of duty. Laieik. 104.
See KOHU, to agree; to be alike. To resemble; hookohu ke keiki a Daniela i kona makua; to cause a resemblance; to make a likeness; to set apart for one’s self.
To dither, i.e., approximate the appearance of a graphic image from another computer operating system. Lit. assume a likeness until similar.

Redup. of hoʻokohu; to pretend, impersonate, disguise, pose; affectation. Hoʻokohukohu kūlana mākaʻikiʻu, impersonation of the office of detective. He hoʻokohukohu hoʻohanohano (Kep. 105), a person pretending to honors not due. Hoʻokohukohu Akua, to put on a show of serving God. Hoʻokohukohu aliʻi, to assume the manners of a chief.
See the foregoing. To ask with forwardness.
To affect resemblance; to be assuming.
To make advances to a woman with a view to have her for a wife.
To agree together.
Caus/sim of koi.
See KOI, to urge on; to compel. To speak in a rough harsh voice; to make rough or harsh; to urge; to drive on.
Same as hoʻokoʻikoʻi.

definitions.der: [Lit. to act emphatically without puffing fire [that will reveal the fire maker]]
definitions.dtxt: To deepen the voice; to stress or emphasize in speech; to treat with severity, harshness, rigor; to burden, oppress. Hoʻohana ihola kō ʻAikupika i nā mamo o ʻIkelaʻela me ka hoʻokoʻikoʻi, the Egyptians made the children of Israel serve with rigor. Hoʻokoʻikoʻi pua ahi ʻole, to practice trickery secretly, stealthily, without giving oneself away;
See koʻikoʻi, weight.
A bearing of a burden; the act of making one sad; putting one in circumstances very disagreeable and grievous to be borne.
See KOIKOI, heaviness; weight. To make heavy literally or morally; to oppress; to treat with rigor.
To stress; accent.
To make great pretensions of forbidding iniquity, and at the same time to practice it secretly.
definitions.notes: Note: This is a new coined word adapted to modern times.

definitions.dtxt: See KOINE, to hasten. To be calm, as the mind; to be at rest; to be quiet.
Executor of an estate (o-class).
Caus/sim of kōkē.
To cause bloodshed; to blush (rare). Fig. Angry. Cf. piʻi ka ʻula under piʻi.
See KOKO, blood. To spill, as a liquid; to flow, as blood.
Caus/sim of kokoe. Hōʻināʻinau mea ipo i ka nahele, hoʻokokoe ana ka maka i ka moani (chant), lovers are wooing in the woods, casting shy glances at the wafted fragrance.
Slow and stunted of growth; black and threatening, as clouds before a storm; forceful. Same as haʻakokōhi 1, 2.
Running low; black; thick; threatening, as clouds; he ao hookokohi, a thick black cloud.
To be black and threatening, as clouds; to lower.
To draw near, approach.
See kokoke, near.
See KOKOKE, near either in time or place; to cause to draw near: to approach.
To cluster, i.e., find addends or factors that are nearly alike, in math.
To zoom in, as with a movie or video camera. Cf. hoʻolaulā.
See KOLE, raw; uncooked. To remain uncooked; unfinished.
To rise, as a thick black cloud.
Caus/sim of kokolo.
See KOLO, to crawl. To cause one to crawl or creep.
To stoop or bend down.
To rouse, encourage, incite.
To be at rest; to be quiet.
To stir up; to provoke.
To arouse sexual excitement, titillate.
See AKOLA and AIKOLA, to triumph. To rejoice at the ills of another; to express such joy.
Caus/sim of kolakola.
To rouse up the sexual passions.
To line up vertically, place in columns. E hoʻokolamu i kēia palapala no ka nūpepa e puka ana. Make this document into colunm format for the newspaper that’s coming out. Comb. hoʻo- + kolamu.
Same as hoʻokolekole.
See KOLE, raw, as flesh. To make red, as raw meat; to look red; to make raw flesh.
Caus/sim of kolekole. to cook rare; to skin, denude, bruise. Hoʻokolekole maka, to make the rude gesture.
See above. To make raw or red, as raw or fresh meat.
To flutter, wave.
See KOLILI. To flutter in the wind.
To cause to creep, crawl; to follow a trail, track, clue; to trace to a source. Cf. hoʻokolokolo.
See KOLO, to creep; to crawl. To cause to creep or crawl along; to walk bent over; to crouch.
To approach one with the intention of entering into conversation with him.
To draw near to a chief to inform against one.

definitions.notes: Note: In ancient times all persons sent for by a chief as suspected or accused of an offense, and all who came to a chief to ask a favor, approached him on their hands and knees, crawling from a distance.
definitions.dtxt: To approach humbly to ask a favor.

To do mischief, play pranks, etc.; to cause to be mischievous; to disturb, annoy; to do amusing things to create laughter; funny, humorous, comical, mischievous. Hoʻokolohe nohoʻi kāna hīmeni ʻana, he sings in such an amusing manner.
Experiment; to experiment, as in a laboratory. Comb. hoʻokolo + hua. See pahiki hoʻokolohua. Hoʻokolohua no. To experiment on. Hoʻokolohua me. To experiment with.
To try in court, judge, investigate; judiciary; trial. Hoʻokolokolo moku, admiralty cases. See hale hoʻokolokolo.
See kolokolo.
Intensive of the above. To call to account.
To question with the design of eliciting some fact; to investigate by questioning.
To try an accused person; to hold a court.

Māhele ʻaha hoʻokolokolo. Judicial branch (of a government). Mana hoʻokolokolo. Appellate jurisdiction, i.e., a court’s authority to hear an appeal of a decision made by another court. Mana hoʻokolokolo maka mua. Original jurisdiction, in law.
Caus/sim of kololio.
To colonize, particularly from the perspective of a people who have been colonized by a dominant culture or political entity. Comb. hoʻo- + kolonaio. Cf. hoʻopanalāʻau. See kolonaio.
Same as hoʻokananuha.
See KOLO and NUHA, silent. Sullen; silent; refusing to speak. See example above.
Hookolo and nuha, to sit doubled up in silence. To sit bent over in sullen silence; not to reply when spoken to; aole ou kanaka hookolonuha, e like, you have no man sullen like him.
Street name.

example_txt.txt: hoʻokomo i ke kālā i ka panakō
to deposit money in the bank

definitions.dtxt: To insert, put or let in, enter, pack, penetrate, import, sink into, deposit, install, admit. See niho hoʻokomo.
To dress another person.
See komo, to enter, and komo, to dress.
See KOMO, to enter; to sink down. To cause to enter in various ways; to enter an aperture; to enter the door of a house; to sink down into, as into water.
To file, as files in a file cabinet. Also waiho. See entries below.

example_txt.txt: Hoʻokomo ʻia aku nei kōna waihona ma kōna inoa hope.
His file was filed under his last name.
deposit, as money placed into a bank account
caret (^), a mark used to show where something is to be inserted, in proofreading
a circle around a period, colon, or semicolon to show that it has been inserted

definitions.dtxt: To insert, put in, as a disk into a computer.
Land section, Humuʻula qd.; hill, Hilo district, Hawaiʻi.
To sink (make) a basket, in basketball.
To cause a spirit, usually evil, to possess; possession.
To dress, as children; to file, put in.
See KOMO and KOMOKOMO, to enter. To cause to enter frequently.
To be supplied, as with food; to be satiated with eating.
To play at a game called komokomo.
To initiate. Comb. hoʻo- + komo pae. See komo pae, hana komo pae.
Caus/sim of konā.
See KONA, to be strong. To be brave; to dare; to be hard upon.
Caus/sim of koni.
See KONI, to taste; to try. To try; to experience; to make plain.
To ask or try a little by way of begging or making a bargain; to tempt.
Caus/sim of konini.
See KONINI, to revive from fainting. To cause to shoot up or grow like a plant.
To swell, as a bud.
To convalesce, as a sick person.
To invite.
See KONO, to invite. To invite; to lead along.
To induce, entice, urge persistently, especially to urge someone to will him his property; to set dogs to fight.
A setting on, as dogs to fight; a getting up a difficulty between persons that they may fight and kill each other.
See KONO, to invite; to urge. To set on; to urge, as dogs to fight.
To entice so as to force one to do wickedly.
To stir up or excite feeling in one.
To send frequently to hurry one on; to be induced to do a thing. Laieik. 128.
To regulate, i.e., to fix the time, amount, degree, or rate of something by making adjustments. (Tongan fakatonutonu.) Lōkuʻu hoʻokonukonu pūnao. Thyroid gland.
Prop with a pole, as a heavily laden banana plant, or a house to keep it from falling down; to pole, as a canoe.
To push, brace, resist, lean back and brace oneself.
Caus/sim of koʻū.
Street name.
To separate by a space.
To produce a resemblance, likeness. Na ia mea i hoʻokū ā maʻi iaʻu, that thing made me ill.

To set up, make stand, establish, as a society; to brace a canoe with a paddle while sailing or coasting over waves in order to steer and steady the canoe; to carry on, as a family name. Hoʻokū ākea, to make known publicly.
See kū, to stand, and kū, in a state of.
See KU, to stand. To cause to stand; to stand erect; to stick up in a perpendicular position.
To decline; to withhold; to refuse; to be unwilling.
To hold water with the paddles when the canoe is sailing.
To persevere in work even when interest and pleasure have gone from it; burdensome. He hana hoʻokua nui, it’s a very burdensome job.
To fail in one’s strength, as after much and long effort one’s spirits and strength begin to fail.
To act like one from the couentry; countrified, rustic.
Caus/sim of kūāhua.
Caus/sim of kuaʻiʻi.
To influence one into bad behavior; evil.
Same as hoʻokūʻiʻo.
Var. of hoʻohuakeʻeo. (FOR. 5:561)
To remove obstruction, interference; to clear the way, free.
Kapa To make such an anvil.
To bleach or whiten. E aloha aʻe ana kēia i ka hau hoʻokuakea ʻili (song), this is a fond recollection of the snow that whitens the skin.
Var. of hoʻohuakeʻeo.
See hoʻohuakeʻeo. To act contrary to; to go to an extreme in anything because of anger, as when a little is asked and a great deal is thrown to him in anger.
To change form; transubstantiation.
To heap up, as in banks; to make spaces between lines of stitching in quilting.
To trade, buy and sell.
Caus/sim of kualana.; to fail in strength. (FOR. 6:428)
To whiten. Cf. aliali, clear.
See kūʻamiʻami, the motion of a hinge. To make motions, perhaps indelicate ones, like a hinge.
Caus/sim of kūamuamu.
To make lonely, barren. Fig. To behave ignorantly; to cause boredom, dreariness; boring. He hana hoʻokuānea, a boring act.
To meditate, think deeply.
See KUA, back, and NUI, large. To cause the back to swell; to make one work hard; to be severe; to increase; to enlarge, as a swelling.
To enslave, oppress.
To assemble tribute for a high chief.
Caus/sim of kuapuʻu.
To cause opposition, to stir up resistance; to oppose, clash.
See kūʻē, to oppose.
See KUE, to resist. To cause to resist; to oppose; to make opposition.
To stir up opposition or disagreement.
To elbow, push with the elbows.
See KUEKUE, the knuckle or elbow joint. To elbow; to jog with the elbow; to push.
See the above. To excite anger; to stir up opposition; to grin with a frown.
To frown. Hoʻokuʻekuʻemaka nui, to frown severely, scowl.
See above with MAKANUI, great face. To grin most horridly with rage or anger.
Caus/sim of kuekuene.
See KUENE. To make way.
To wait on one.
To move back and forth, as a fan in fanning.
To cool one with a fan.
To frown, scowl.
To frown. Cf. pūtē.
Caus/sim of kuene.; all meanings.
See KUENE, to measure. To take the measure for laying out a building; to measure; to lay out.
Setup; to set up, as in a computer program. Lit. lay out, arrange. Hoʻokuene ʻaoʻao. Page setup.
To browse, as in a database program having the capability to rearrange data. Lit. set up data. Cf. mākaʻikaʻi, kele.
Caus/sim of kuewa.
See KUEWA, to wander. To wander about, as a vagabond; to go here and there without object; to be friendless.
To teach the art of gesturing in the hula; to point, etc.
Caus/sim of kuhi.
See KUHI, to think. To cause to guess; to suppose; to think.
To entangle; to cause to entangle. See KAHIHI.
Caus/sim of kuhikuhi.
Freq. of hookuhi. To guess; to think; to be uncertain.
See kuhō, the sound of a stone falling perpendicularly in the water. To sound short and quick, as a stone falling perpendicularly in the water.
To cough; to cough up from the throat.
Street name.
To hit, pound, collide, crash, bump. Fig. To hurt the feelings.
See kuʻi, to pound.

example_txt.txt: Hoʻokuʻi nei kou alelo i ka hoʻopunipuni.

definitions.dtxt: To join, connect, annex, weld, unite; to connect, as letters in forming a word; to spell; to dovetail, fit, splice; to add up, as numbers.

example_txt.txt: mai ka hoʻokuʻi ā ka hālāwai

definitions.dtxt: Zenith
A joining or connecting; o kahi mawaena o ka lani ame ka honua, ua kapaia he lewa, he hookui ame ka halawai.
See KUI, to join. To stitch together, as with a needle; to stitch together, as the five kapas for a pau or sleeping kapas.
To pierce, as in sewing cloth or kapa.
To join together, as letters in making a word, i.e., to spell.
To meet together.
To connect, as in a computer program. Cf. hoʻohemo. See kuʻina.

example_txt.txt: E ʻoluʻolu e hoʻokuʻi i ka mōkema me ke kamepiula.
Please connect the modem to the computer.

definitions.dtxt: To crash, as cars; to bump or bang into. See entries below.
To open or complete, as an electric circuit. See ʻoki.
Kaha hoʻokuʻi. A curved line (or lines) linking two letters or words to indicate that the letters or words should be joined, in proofreading.
Street, Punchbowl, Honolulu. (The street was so named because of the frequent accidents on its curved route.) (TM)
Same as above; checks and balances, as in government.

example_txt.txt: Hoʻokumu ʻia ka hoʻokuʻia ma waena o nā māhele nui ʻekolu o ke aupuni pekelala o ʻAmelika i mea e makaʻala ai i ka hoʻokō ʻia o ka mana o kēlā me kēia māhele.
The system of checks and balances between the three divisions of the federal government of the United States was set up so that the exercise of power among each division could be checked.

definitions.dtxt: Checks and balances, as in government.
To foul deliberately, in team sports such as basketball. Cf. kuʻia.

example_txt.txt: ʻAʻole ʻo ia i ʻūpoʻi i ke kinipōpō; hoʻokuʻia ahuwale ʻē ʻia ʻo ia e ke kūpale.
He didn't get a chance to dunk the ball; he was intentionally fouled by the defender.

definitions.dtxt: Mail merge, as in a computer program. Lit. splice addresses. Cf. hoʻokuʻi pū.
Street name.
To unite, reconcile, agree, make a peace treaty or armistice; armistice. Lā Hoʻokuʻikahi, Armistice Day.
ʻAha hoʻokuʻikahi. Convention, i.e., an assembly of people who meet for a common purpose, in politics.
See KUIKAHI, to unite in one. To unite in one; to agree together.
To make a treaty of peace and friendship.
To show beforehand; to recognize at sight.
Redup. of hoʻokuʻi; to jostle.

example_txt.txt: Hiki iā Laʻakea ke hoʻokuʻikuʻi i nā hua ʻōlelo.

definitions.dtxt: Redup. of hoʻokuʻi.
Something united or put together; a sentence; a collection of words.
See KUI, to unite. To unite: to join together; to put words together, as in a dictionary.
To collect in one mass.
To unite by sewing, as cloth; e hookuikui i ka manai, a uo i ke kaula a lawa.
To resemble; to be like.
To splice, as film or video segments for movie or video production.
Same as above. Hoʻokuʻina ʻami, hinge joint.
A uniting; a joining; a seam in a garment; he hookuina ami, a hinge joint. Anat. 18.
Convinced; to prove, verify; to insist on the truth of a matter.
To merge, as in a computer program. Lit. join together. Cf. hoʻokuʻi helu wahi.
To shoo, drive off, banish, expel, oust, evict, eject.
See KUKE, to drive off. To throw away; to banish; to drive off.
To simulate. Comb. hoʻo- + kū + kohukohu. Cf. hoʻomeamea.
To take a neutral position. Comb. hoʻo- + kūkonu. Cf. kūkonu.
To cause to shake; to shake, bounce; uncomfortably full, as after overeating.
See kūkū, to shake.
Fullness of food; over eating.
Full, as with food; satiated.
Fitted; having a resemblance.
See KU, to stand. A standing up, as in the practice of boxing. Laieik. 46.
See KUKU, stuffed with food. To eat to uncomfortable fullness; to stuff with food.
To have a sufficiency; to eat enough.
To eat food voraciously; applied to many eating together; applied to one person it is hoonuu.
To try or fit on, as a garment.
To compare. E hoʻokūkū ʻoe i kēia mau pūʻolo manakō. ʻO ka pūʻolo hea ka mea i ʻoi aku kōna kaumaha? Compare these bags of mango. Which bag is heavier?
Tournament, in sports. Niʻihau. Also hoʻokūkū moho. See entries below. Hoʻokūkū pōpaʻipaʻi. Volleyball tournament.
To imitate the walk of a clubfooted person.
Curve-fitting, in math.
Rodeo.
Championship, in sports. See hoʻokūkū kio, hoʻokūkū moho.

definitions.der: [Lit. mock warfare match. See hoʻokūkū kahului, hoʻokūkū moho]
definitions.dtxt: Scrimmage, as for sports.
Caus/sim of kukule.
Caus/sim of kukuli.
See KULI, the knee. To cause to kneel; to kneel down.
Street name.
Tournament, as for sports; playoff or finals, as in sporting events. Also hoʻokūkū. See hoʻokūkū kio, hoʻokūkū kahului.
Round-robin, as in sports. Lit. tournament touching round.
Caus/sim of kulaʻi. Naʻu nō ia e hoʻokulaʻi i ka pahi kaua, I, indeed, am the one to cause [him] to fall by the sword.
To make into a bird place. Ka wai e haʻakula manu, ka nahele o Kēhua i loa i ke kula o hoʻokula manu (PH 220), the water that attracted birds, the forest of Kēhua, far on the plains attracting birds.
Caus/sim of kulana., to cause insecurity.
Caus/sim of kūlanalana.
See KULANALANA, to walk weakly. To walk or stand unsteadily.
To stumble; to recede back.
To harmonize. See kūlauna.

example_txt.txt: E hoʻokūlauna kākou i kēia hīmeni.

definitions.dtxt: To entitle, give right to possess; to give a responsibility. Palapala hoʻokuleana, patent, copyright.
See kuli, deaf.
See KULI, to be deaf. To turn away from hearing; to refuse to hear.
To disregard one’s advice or instruction.
To bribe to disobedience.
To give one’s property for an evil purpose.
Silently; made to say nothing by a bribe, in the phrase moe hookuli.
Caus/sim of kūlia.
To conform, make alike. Ka hoʻokūlike a like i nā ʻaoʻao a ʻelua, to balance the accounts.
Caus/sim of kūlipo.
To bow down, cause to bow, humiliate; to subdue, as an enemy.
See KULOU, to bow. To bow down; to cower; to sit cowering.
To cast the eyes downward.
Caus/sim of kuloukulou.
To bend over, as in sorrow or in pain.
To bend over, etc. See above.
To dink, i.e., to mishit or clip (the ball), in volleyball. Niʻihau. Also paʻi lihi. See ʻai hele wale.
To pair off. Comb. hoʻo- + kūlua. Cf. kūlua (dic.).
Caus/sim of kulukulu. to cause to drip, distill.
See KULU, to drop. To leak; to fall in drops; to drip; to sprinkle with water.
Caus/sim of kumakaia.
To cause an ambuscade; to betray; to accuse an innocent person.
To cause to wail, as persons for the dead.
Caus/sim of kūmene.
To smooth, make even, as stones in a wall.
Street name.
To make a beginning, originate, create, commence, establish, inaugurate, initiate, institute, found, start.
See kumu, beginning.
See KUMU, foundation. To settle; to root; to establish; to appoint to a particular business or office; to lay a foundation.
Palapala hoʻokumu. Charter, a document defining the organization of a city, colony, or corporate body.
Caus/sim of kūnaʻi.
To make a conquest; to conquer; to show an exterminating spirit.
See HOOKULANA, n substituted for l. To step sideways; to stumble in walking.
Caus/sim of kūnānā.
To hesitate in speaking; to be undecided.
See kūnou and kūlou. Lit. To stand bent. To bow, as the head; to nod, as the head; to wag the head, or shake it in derision; to bow; to bend over.
To cause coughing; to pretend to cough.
See KUNU, to cough. To cause to cough; to make one cough; to hack and cough. See HOOKUHO.
Caus/sim of kūō.; to pretend to howl.
Caus/sim of kūkoʻe.
To cause to be or act the vagabond; to wander about without business or care; to live in poverty; to be worthless.
A disease from the illicit intercourse of the sexes. See KUOHA.
Similar to ʻoi 2. ʻO ka lani hoʻokūʻoi kapu (chant), the superior sacred chief.
Caus/sim of kūʻoʻi.
See OI 3. To limp; to walk with unequal steps.
To establish independence, make independent.
See KUOKOA, to stand aside. To cause to stand aside; to put one by himself; to make another.
Caus/sim of kuolo.
See KUOLO, to shake; to tremble. To shake; to be unsteady, as with the palsy; to have the palsy.
Caus/sim of kuoni.
See KUONI, to move gently. To move a little; to move slightly or easily; to walk slowly; to lag behind.
To indent, form a bay, cranny, or corner.
See KUONO, a bay or gulf. To sink in, as the eye in sickness; to sink down; to indent, as the land on the sea shore and cause a bay.
See kūʻonoʻono, well-off.
To prosper. ʻĀina hoʻokūʻonoʻono, homestead land. Poʻe hoʻokūʻonoʻono, homesteaders.
Persons living at ease having a competency of the means of living; aole hune nui o ka poe hookuonoono, he lako lakou.
See KUONOONO, a sufficiency. To be supplied; to have sufficiency.
To be quiet; to remain quiet a long time; to be well established.
To put in order; to keep in order.
To act serious, get serious.
See KUOO, to stand ready. To stand ready; to be prepared for any business or event; to be in readiness for a call.
To assume great gravity for the sake of deception.
To be or work like a cooper; to act the cooper.
See KUPA. To dig out; to cut; to hew, as in digging out a canoe.
Street name.
To naturalize, make a citizen. Palapala hoʻokupa, citizenship papers.
See kupa, citizen.

example_txt.txt: Ua hoʻokūpaʻa ʻoe i nā kuli e hemo ana.
Hoʻokūpaʻa i ka ʻōlelo o kēia pelika.
Perform the words of this covenant.

definitions.dtxt: To remain loyal, firm, etc.; to persist, perform, make fast, strengthen, fortify, establish.
See KUPAA, to stand fast. To cause to stand fast; to confirm, as an agreement; to make perpetual, as a promise or covenant.
To stack, as windows in computer program. Comb. hoʻo- + kūpaʻi. Hoʻokūpaʻi pukaaniani. To stack windows.
Caus/sim of kupainaha.
See HOOKUPA. To cut; to carve; to pare; to dig.
To emit fragrance; fragrant.
Caus/sim of kupe.
To turn, as one’s ankle or foot in walking; hence, causing a stumbling.
Caus/sim of kūpene.
To reflect, as light, heat, or sound. Hoʻokūpī ʻia ka mālamalama ma ke aniani. The light is reflected in the mirror. Comb. hoʻo- + kūpī See kūpī.
Caus/sim of kūpikiʻō.
To behave uprightly; to conform to; to go straight toward, face toward, proceed correctly.
Caus/sim of kūpouli.; anguish (Kel. 22). Hoʻokūpouli ka manaʻo (Kel. 15), worried thoughts.
Street name.
To cause growth, sprouting; to sprout.
See kupu, sprout.
A tax; a taxation; a tribute to one in higher standing; a present; a gift; a gratification.
Liable to taxation; mea hookupu, a tributary. Taxed; laid under tribute.
See KUPU, to spring up. To cause to grow up, as a vegetable; to spring up, as a seed.
To pay or gather a tax; to pay a tax or tribute.
To accomplish; to perform.
To give freely; to make a present to one.
Caus/sim of kūpū.; to thicken.
To take a person as a grandparent or grandaunt or granduncle because of affection; an adopted grandparent; to act as a grandparent.

To release, let go, put down, dismiss, send away, abandon, disperse, adjourn; to expel, as from school; to discharge, as from work; to free, acquit, let, permit, excuse, exempt, liberate; to settle, clear up; slope of a hill (rare). Hīmeni hoʻokuʻu, closing hymn. Kī hoʻokuʻu, slack key. Hihia ua hoʻokuʻu ʻia, case [of law] settled. Hoʻokuʻu kāua, let’s stop [as a meeting]. Hoʻokuʻu ʻia mai ka hopu ʻia ʻana, exemption from arrest. Hoʻokuʻu maikaʻi, honorable discharge.
See kuʻu, to release.
Let down; loosened; dismissed.
See KUU, to loosen. To let go; to dismiss; to send away; to release; to let down.
Hoʻokuʻu i ka wai o ka lua. To flush a toilet. Niʻihau. Also hoʻoholo i ka wai. ʻAu hoʻokuʻu wai o ka lua. Toilet handle (preceded by ke).

To cede, as land or territory. Hoʻokuʻu ʻaelike ʻia ka ʻāina o Tekasa iā ʻAmelika Hui Pū ʻia ma hope o ke kaua me Mekiko. Texas was ceded to the United States after the war with Mexico. Lit. release (by) agreement.
To ovulate. Lit. release ovum. See huaʻine,

Caus/sim of kuʻukuʻu.; lenient, permissive; to pay out, as a fishline. Kī hoʻokuʻukuʻu, slack key, as on a guitar [kī hōʻalu is more common]. Ua hoʻokuʻukuʻu loa na mākua i keiki, parents are too lenient with children.
Freq. of above. To let down, as a rope; to subside, or cause to retire.
Suspension, as from school; to suspend. Ua hoʻokuʻu ʻia ʻo Kalani no ka manawa i hoʻopaʻi nōna. Kalani was suspended from school as his punishment. Lit. expel temporarily. Cf. hoʻapaʻi ʻauʻa.
To stay or keep on the outside.
See KUEKUE, the knuckle or elbow joint. To elbow; to jog with the elbow; to push.
Caus/sim of kūwō.; to pretend to howl.
To withhold openly; to be parsimonious.
Street name.
To sun, put out in the sunlight.
See lā, sun.
See ola, life.
Small piece of tapa; tapa in general (Kauaʻi).
A kapa or Hawaiian cloth; applied mostly to single kapas; but on Kauai, used instead of the word kapa generally.
A remnant; a piece.
Used for hooola. Safety after danger; deliverance from peril; salvation as of a people.
For hooola. See OLA, to recover from sickness. To have ease after pain; to recover from sickness.
To save from danger; to cure a disease.
To deliver or free from death.
Same as hōʻolāʻolā.
Small piece of tapa; tapa in general (Kauaʻi).
Street name.
To consecrate, dedicate, sanctify, bless, hallow. Ka hoʻolaʻa ʻana, the consecration, dedication.
To consecrate. See laʻa 1.
See LAA, to consecrate.
To consecrate; to hallow; to set apart for a particular purpose, especially for religious purposes.
Dedication of a house; to dedicate a house.
Var. of hoʻolāʻau. See lāʻau.
For hoolala. See LALA, a branch; a limb. To branch out, as the limbs of trees.
To form mature wood, as of a shrub; to gather in trees, as birds.
See lāʻau, tree, and lāʻau.
To ask, as a child for food.
To swell up, as the stomach.
Blessing of a canoe launching; to dedicate a canoe.
To pretend to be wise; to act smart; pretentious.
To clear up, brighten.
See LAE, the forehead, and HONUA, entirely. To bow or carry the face low, as one affecting great solemnity.
Redup. of hoʻolaʻe.
See LAELAE, clear. To be clear; to shine; to be bright, as an unclouded sky.

To spread abroad, publish, advertise, broadcast, disseminate, distribute, circulate, make known, promulgate, increase, propagate; advertisement, propagation, publicity. Hoʻolaha kūʻai, hoʻolaha hoʻolilo, notice of sale. Hoʻolaha lima hana, help-wanted ad. Hoʻolaha manaʻoʻiʻo, propagation of the faith.
See laha, extended.
See LAHA, to spread out. To spread out; to widen; to spread abroad, i.e., to publish extensively, as news; to cause to become of general interest.
See papa hoʻolaha, Papa Lawelawe Hoʻolaha.
Advertisement, ad; commercial.
Redup. of hoʻolaha. Lele hoʻolahalaha, to soar in the air with outspread wings; to hover without perceptible wing movement.
To bear; to carry, as on a double-canoe or peleleu.
See LAHAI and LALAHAI, to hover over. To hover over, as a bird; to flap the wings without making any advance, as an owl.
To float in the air, as a kite.
To cause thinness, frailty; thin, frail.
See LAHO, the testicles. To rub the testicles; to practice onanism.
Street name.
To cause to be consecrated; to taboo.
To form a nation, race, etc.
See LAHUI, to prohibit. To cause to be consecrated; to be made kapu; to forbid the doing of a thing.
Street name.
To cause to be still; to poise aloft, as a bird; to quiet, as a mob; to cease talking; calm; peaceful, quiet.
See LAI, to be still. To appease; to quiet, as a mob; to be quiet; to be still.
Street, Sheridan Tract, Honolulu.
Caus/sim of laʻilaʻi.
To tame, domesticate; to treat with kindness, as a child or animal, so as to familiarize with one.
See laka.
See LAKA, tame, as an animal. To tame; to domesticate, as an animal; to take away wildness by quiet friendly treatment.
Redup. of hoʻolaka.
See hoʻolaka. To make tame, etc.
To bring luck; lucky.
Street name.
Street name.
To supply, equip, provide, furnish, enrich.
To insinuate, suggest, implant a thought, either good or bad.
See lako.
See LAKO, a sufficiency. To supply; to cause a supply; to be furnished; to supply for an emergency; to prepare; to get ready.
Hoʻolako me ka heluna makemake. Supply and demand. See heluna makemake.
To lend, as money lent at interest. Comb. hoʻo- + lako ʻaiʻē. Cf. lawe ʻaiʻē, ʻae. See lako ʻaiʻē.
To supply arms, arm, fortify.
Redup. of hoʻolako.
Freq. of the above.
Street name.
To turn aside.
A stick once crooked that has been made straight; he hau hana ka inoa o ia wahi i ka hoolalaia.
To move aside out of the course, as one sailing in the surf turns off and goes some where else.
To cause to branch out, as by topping; to branch out. to lay out land areas; to mark with lines; to plan, make plans or projects (see ex., ʻōhio).
See LALA and HOOLAALAA, to branch out. To branch out, as the branches of a tree; to divide off different ways.
To lay the foundation of a work; to commence a job.
To begin or commence a work or business.

See papa hoʻolālā. Mākau hoʻolālā. Planning skill. Keʻena Hoʻolālā o ke Kalana. County Planning Department. ʻOihana Hoʻolālā a me ka Hoʻomohala Waiwai o ka Mokuʻāina ʻo Hawaiʻi. Hawaiʻi State Department of Planning and Economic Development.
To stop up a path; to plant or cause bushes to grow.
See LAHAI and HOOLAHALAHAI.
To cause to swell.
To align, as type in a computer program.

example_txt.txt: E hoʻolālani i nā kinona ma ʻekolu kolamu a me ʻekolu lālani.
Align the shapes in three columns and three rows.
horizontal lines written above and below a word or words to indicate that they should be written or printed straight, in proofreading

definitions.dtxt: To place in rows.
To insist on accompanying. Kaʻu poʻe moʻopuna he hoʻolalaʻō i ka hele me aʻu, my grandchildren insist on going with me.

To cause to wander, lead astray; to procrastinate, dillydally, kill time; to digress or wander in speech, perhaps to avoid a subject; to deceive, as in actions to conceal what one is about; to divert, as a child from the matter he is crying about; roundabout.
See lalau, mistake.
To cause to seize, etc.; to tackle.
See lālau, to seize.
To cause hallucination. Comb. hō- + ʻolalau + manaʻo. Cf. manaʻo ʻolalau (dic.). Mea hōʻolalau manaʻo. Hallucinogen.
To produce thrills, itching.
To hasten, incite, propose, provoke, hurry; to urge, suggest strongly, encourage. Ua hoʻolale mai ʻoia iaʻu e hele i Hilo, he suggested that I go to Hilo.
See LALE, to urge on. To stir up; to hasten the doing of a thing; to excite to action; to get ready quickly for an event.
Street name.
To gather together, as flowers.
Redup. of hoʻolale; to inspire, incite, rouse.
See HOOLALE. To get ready quickly; to put in order in a hurry, as a house when a visitor comes unexpectedly; to hasten generally.
To cause greasiness, glitter.
Street name.
A. Same as lana 3. b. Disobedient, willful. Hoʻolana nohoʻi nā keiki, the children are so willful.
See lana, floating.
Indifference in regard to morals and moral principles; aole e pili nui kekahi mau hewa iloko o ka pono, o ka hookaulana, o ka hoolana, etc.
See LANA, to float; to hope. To cause to float; to be light; to float upon, as upon water.
To offer, as a sacrifice.
To listen with attention; e hoolana, i ka pepeiao.
Manehu hoʻolana. Buoyant force, i.e., the upward force of a fluid on an object in it.
Ancient surfing area, Kohala district, Hawaiʻi. (Finney, 1959a:51)
To cause to triumph; overbearing or impudent, as of a spoiled child unafraid of punishment, or of a most privileged, unassailable person.
See LANAKILA, to overcome. To cause to triumph.
To make lashings, to lash.
Redup. of hoʻolana.
See LANA and LANALANA. To cause to be light; to float, etc.
Hopeful, encouraging. (Kel. 15) See hoʻolana under lana 1.
Street name.
A. Redup. of hoʻolani; to treat as a chief; to claim relationship to a chief, especially unwarranted. b. To exalt, praise.
To exalt; to praise.
To enjoy the privileges of a chief.
To take deceitfully (as Puniai did from Kauwa.)
To get something in the eye.
To tie up, as small sticks for fuel.
To fish for eels thus. (Var. pronunciation is hoʻolaʻoa.) Nui ka iwi, he hoʻolaoa, there are many bones, they cause choking.
A hook for catching eels.
To cause gurgling; to gargle. E hele e hōʻolāʻolā i ka puʻu, go and gargle for your throat.
See ʻolāʻolā.
For hooolaola. See OLAOLA, the sound of the throat in drinking. To gurgle, as water when drinking.
See LAOLAO, a bundle. To do up in bundles; to tie up, as a bundle for carrying; to tie a string around.
Street name.

A. To rise up; to boil; to swell, as a blister; to spread or blaze, as fire or volcanic eruption; to excite or flare, as with passion; to animate; to cook by boiling. Hoʻolapa ka ʻōpū, a disturbed stomach. Ua wala kīʻaha paha, ke hoʻolapa mai nei, the glass is tilted back perhaps, getting active.  b. (Cap) Wind famous at Kau.
To form a ridge; ridge.
See lapa, ridge, and lapa, energetic.
To cause to blast off, as a rocket; to launch, as a spaceship. Comb. ho- + ʻōlapa. Cf. ʻōlapa. See helu ʻōlapa.
To cause to blaze, boil, etc. Ipu hoʻolapalapa, boiler.
See LAPA, a ridge, and LAPALAPA. To spin round, as a top.
To roll, as the wheel of a plow.
To boil; to bubble up, as boiling water: to fry.
To blaze, as a blazing fire.
See ola pānaʻi.
A redeemer.
For hooolapanai. See HOOLA, to save, and PANAI, to redeem. To save one by redeeming; to buy one’s liberty who is in bondage; to redeem.
Caus/sim of lāpeʻe.
See LAPEE, to bend over. To bend up; to double over; to swell up.
To pretend to be a ghost, as children on Halloween.
See lapu, ghost.
Caus/sim of lapulapu.
Caus/sim of lāpuʻu.
See LAPUU, to bend up. See also LAPEE. To bend over; to arch; to crook; to recede from a straight line.
A. To use a lau. b. A bundle of grass or ferns set in water to attract shrimps or ʻoʻopu fish; a net was placed under this bundle, and the fish shaken into it.
To grow leaves; to leaf out.
See lau, leaf; lau, dragnet; and lau, much.
To make numerous; to assemble, as of numerous persons or animals; numerous.
See LAU, many; the number 400. To make numerous; to make company for one.
To take away the solitude of a place.
Street name.
To cherish, as a beloved memory. I ka make ʻana o kāna kāne, ua hoʻolauaʻe aʻela ʻoia i ke aloha, at the death of her husband, she cherished the loving memory.
To hide; to conceal; to go or put away out of sight; to deceive.
To coordinate, put in order. Comb. hoʻo- + laukaʻi. See hoʻokaʻina, laukaʻi.
To have many people about one; to dispel loneliness with people. Ka manu hoʻolaukanaka, o ia uka ʻiu ano (song), the bird that dispels loneliness in that far, quiet upland.
Same as above. I malumalu ai kāna pūnua i manaʻo ai e hoʻolaukoa (chant for Kawānanakoa), to shelter their fledglings which they expect to feather out.
To treat cruelly, mercilessly; to oppress; to cause hatred.

example_txt.txt: to broaden the mind or thought

definitions.dtxt: Same as laulā; to broaden, widen, extend.
See laulā, broad.
To generalize; to zoom out, as with a movie or video camera. Cf. hoʻokokoke. See hoʻolaulā hawewe.
To spread, circulate, publicize, make known.
To publicize. Mea hoʻolaulaha. Publicist.
To amplify, i.e., increase the amplitude of a wave. Lit. widen waves. See laulā hawewe.
See HOOLAOLAO and LAULAU. To tie up a bundle.
Street name.
Celebration. See lauleʻa.

Celebration, festival, gathering for a celebration, large party; satisfaction; to hold a celebration, to celebrate; to reconcile, restore peace or friendship, appease; to preserve friendship and good will; to be at peace with; to seek to please. Ke hoʻolauleʻa nei anei au i kānaka, a i ke Akua anei?, do I now persuade men or God? Hāʻawi aku iā ʻoukou i nā hoʻolauleʻa ʻana ā nui wale ma ke kūʻai ʻana aku ma koʻu hale kūʻai, to give you great satisfaction in making purchases at my store.
See LAULEA, to be on friendly terms with. To appease; to calm one angry; to satisfy an injured party; to reconcile.
To get to cooperate.
To smooth; to spread out smoothly and evenly; to free of bumps or lumps.
To smooth, as in a computer program. Cf. hoʻokalakala.
Street name.
To introduce one person to another; to be friendly. Hoʻo launa ʻana, introduction. Ke hoʻolauna aku nei au i mua o ʻoukou, I introduce myself to you.
See launa, friendly.
To handshake, as in a computer program.
See LAUNA, friendly. To be on good terms with one; to act the part of a friend.
Caus/sim of launea.
Street name.
To make an abundance, supply, cause an increase, reproduce.
To show signs of fading, of a leaf; to show signs of failing health; also same as lau pala.
See LAUWILI, to turn; to be fickle. To cause to twist; to take many positions or shapes.
To go round and round in speaking; to use many words in saying little.
To be inconstant or fickle in doing a thing.
Street name.
To supply, apportion sufficiently, equip. E hoʻolawa mai ʻoe i lau hala e apaʻa ai kēia moena, supply me enough pandanus leaves to finish this mat.
See lawa 1.
See LAWA, sufficiency; enough. To finish; to make means suit the intended purpose; to accomplish a purpose.
To have enough; to be supplied.
To finish alike. See above.
Stream, Haʻikū qd., Maui.
To subtract. See lawe 1.
To cause to take, pretend to take, deduct, subtract; subtraction, deduction, minus. E hoʻolawe lua mai ka ʻewalu, a ʻo ka haʻina he ʻeono, take two from eight and the answer is six. (PPN lawe).
See LAWE, to carry. To draw out; to carry from one place to another; to cause to bear or carry; to take away.
Subtraction; to subtract, in math. Ct.lawe.
Accusation; to accuse; to grow worse, of a sickness, especially an insignificant one. He wahi ʻeha wale nō kēia i hoʻolawehala, this is just a little pain that has become worse.
See lawehala, sin.
Treachery; seeking evil of one; a desire to detract from one’s reputation.
To seek occasion against one; to find something for ground of accusation.
See the foregoing. To carry frequently; to get things together; to make ready; to wait on, as a servant; to do this and that.
To deny, repudiate. See ʻole.

definitions.der: [Lit. deny Pope. Hōʻole pule, to deny authority to act as a priest. Hōʻole ʻana, waiver. (PEP kole]
definitions.dtxt: To deny, refuse, reject, veto, contradict, prohibit, protest, nullify, disclaim, renounce, repudiate; refusal, denial, negative. Hōʻole loa, to deny or refuse absolutely. Hōʻole ʻino, to spurn. Hōʻole Akua, to deny the existence of God; atheist. Hōʻole lama, temperate; teetotaler. Hōʻole wai ʻona, prohibition of intoxicants. Hōʻole Pope, Protestant;)
For hooole. See OLE, no; not. To deny; to be unwilling.
To contradict; to refuse assent; to withhold.
Laʻana hōʻole. Counter-example.
Street name.

To cause pleasure, joy; to praise, please, delight, extol; praising, eulogistic. Haʻiʻōlelo hoʻoleʻa, eulogistic speech. ʻEhā kaukani hoʻi i hoʻoleʻa iā Iēhowa me nā mea kani aʻu i hana ai i mea hoʻoleʻa, four thousand then praised Jehovah with the playing instruments I made as praising things.
Praise; the object of praise.
See LEA, to be pleased with. To praise; to extol; to sing praise to.
Old spelling for hōʻole + ai.
Redup. of hoʻoleʻa; to amuse oneself, have fun; amusement. Poʻe hoʻoleʻaleʻa i kānaka, men-pleasers.
Anything pleasing; soothing, as music. Laieik. 79.
See LEA, to please. To amuse; to sport with; to sing in order to attract attention.
To soothe; to assuage; to alleviate sorrow or pain.
Nui Sullen, obstinate, sulky, pouting.
See LEHEI, to jump from a high position. To fly in an imperfect manner, as an unfledged bird.
To jump from a high position.
To dive into the water from a height. See LEHAI.
Caus/sim of lehelehe kiʻi. Kū hoʻolehelehe kiʻi i ka mahina ʻai a Nūkeʻe, standing like a loose-lipped image in the garden of Twist-mouth [doing nothing but talk].
To be disappointed; to be baffled.
Street name.
Swift, expert, strong.
Village, land divisions, and Hawaiian homestead area near the Molokaʻi airport, said to be named for a chief (see Hikauhi).
To make a multitude; to increase into many.
Street name.
To put a lei on oneself or on someone else; to crown.

To cast, throw, heave, toss, pitch; to stretch, send. Hoʻolei ukana, to unload freight. Ka hoʻolei wāwae ʻana, marking time. Hoʻolei wale, to throw away wastefully, heedlessly, uselessly. Hoʻolei wale nō i ke kālā i nā leʻaleʻa lapuwale, merely throwing away money on worthless pleasures. Ua hoʻolei mai me kō lākou waha, they belch out with their mouth. Hoʻolei loa, to throw completely away, to throw far. Hoʻolei loa akula nā wāwae a Nāmakaokahaʻi ā pololei (FOR. 4:69), Nāmakaokahaʻi stretched her legs out straight. Hoʻolei pōpō, name of an old ball game. Pupuʻu hoʻolei loa, to arrive with astonishing speed; to leave and arrive in no time at all; Lit. crouch fling far. Hoʻōho hoʻolei, farflung shout. Hoʻolei koke nō iāia mauka ma ka ʻāina, quickly send him ashore.
To throw. See lei 2.
See LEI, to cast; to throw. To cast or throw away; to reject; to drop carelessly.
See pana hoʻolei.
To juggle. Lit. toss as floating.
Redup. of hoʻolei, to scatter, toss about, swing, dandle, as a baby; to juggle; juggling.
See the above. To cast or throw away often.
Redup. of hoʻoleina.
See HOOLEI and LOA, long; also HOOLOA. To extend or straighten the body; to straighten out; to make straight.
To stretch out the arm or extend it straight.
To stretch out the lower limbs.
Same as leina; place to throw things, as a trash heap. Kahoʻoleinapeʻa (place on Kauaʻi), place where kites are flown. Hoʻoleina moka, dung heap.
For hooleiana. That which is cast or thrown away; refuse matter. See HOOLENA and HOOLINA.
Hoolei and wale. To throw away as useless or worthless.
Street name.

To cause to fly; to fly, as a kite; to disembark, to embark, as on a project; to palpitate, as the heart; to enlarge or project, as pictures. Hoʻolele leo, radio broadcast, broadcaster, microphone, ventriloquism, ventriloquist. Hoʻolele hua kēpau, to set type. Kiʻi hoʻolele, enlargement of a picture. Mea hoʻolele leo, microphone. Mea hoʻolele kiʻi, picture projector. E hoʻolele mai i nā kānaka, disembark the people.
To fly. See lele 1. Cf. haʻalele.
See LELE, to fly. To let fly, as a bird from its eage.
To fix up in the air; to flutter in the wind.
To flutter, as a bird from fear; ua hooleleia ka oili, she was afraid, her heart fluttered. Laieik. 205.
See mīkini hoʻolele kiʻiaka, mīkini hoʻolele kiʻiʻoniʻoni, pākū hoʻolele kiʻi, pahu hoʻolele leo.
See LELEHU 3, to be sleepy. To be sleepy; to writhe, as in the pangs of death.
To turn sideways.
A game of tossing ti leaves into Malama Crater at Puna, Hawaiʻi, and dedicating them to Kamohoaliʻi.

A game played only at Malamakī, Puna, Hawaiʻi. A player would hold a ti leaf in his hand, chant ʻO kēlā kī, ʻo kēia kī, na Kamohoaliʻi kaʻu kī, lele! That ti, this ti, my ti is for Kamohoaliʻi, fly! If the wind was right and the chant correctly rendered, the ti would fly off and return to the sender.
Caus/sim of lelele.

Hoole, to deny, and mana, power; authority. To deny one’s power or authority, as the people in Liholiho’s time denied the authority of the priests and the ancient gods; as the Jews also denied the authority of Jesus Christ.
To stretch, pull back, as a bow.
See HOOLEINA. That which is thrown away, etc.
To deny repeatedly.
Agitated, stormy, tempestuous; rising and falling as waves; disturbing confusing; uneven, as a pavement or a wrinkled mat.
To rise and fall, as the waves of the ocean.
To go about in confusion, as men running hither and thither.
To be uneven; up and down, as a wrinkled mat or floor.
Street name.
To cut, tear; to stir, as water.
See lepe.
See LEPE, the comb of a cock. To be scalloped out, as the comb of a cock; to be cut out.
See ʻōlepe, to turn.
Caus/sim of lepo.
Protestant. Lit. Denier of the Pope.
Protestant. Lit. Denier of the Pope.
See HOOLE, to deny, and PULE, prayer; religion. To deny one’s authority to act as priest, as the people did after Liholiho had broken the kapu. See HOOLEMANA above.

To float, as a cloud; to lift up and carry, as on a stretcher; to suspend. Moe hoʻolewa, stretcher, hammock. Nā mea hoʻolewa, peddlers [they carried their goods swinging on a carrying pole; cf. kālewa 1].

To rotate the hips in dancing, sway See song under Hopoe He aha e ka hana a Anapau la? Hoolewa ka hana a Anapau la (song), what is the work of Anapau there? Rotating the hips is the work of Anapau there
See lewa, to float.
Funeral. Anaina hoʻolewa, funeral wake.
A bearing; a carrying; a floating in the air.
The act of bearing a corpse at a funeral; hence,
A funeral procession.
See LEWA, to swing. To cause to swing; to vibrate; to float in the air.
To lift up and carry, as between two persons; to carry in a manele or palanquin.
To bear or carry a corpse at a funeral procession.
To hang pendulous; to hang down, as a flag without a breeze.
Moving; flying, as clouds that fly low; ina e kokoke mai ke ao, he ao hoolewalewa.
See LEWA. To suspend; to swing back and forth.
Street name.
To give joy, make happy.
To cause fear; to be afraid; to be fearful.
Caus/sim of lihi. to gird.
To decrease, lessen, make small.
Same as the more common hoʻohālike; to equalize, make alike, translate.
See LIKE, to be like. To make alike; to make equal; to liken one thing to another; to make a resemblance.
To divide equally.
Associative, in math.
Redup. of hoʻolike.
Intensive of hoʻolike.
To match, as in the game of concentration.
To tighten.
To provoke jealousy; jealous.
Firm; hard; bold; dignified; important.
The name of the place where the opelu are found.
The putting on of airs; a feeling of one’s importance; the act of creating jealousy in another.
See LILI, jealously. To partially close the eyes on account of a bright light.
To contract the sight of the eye; to make a wry face.
To make one jealous; to cause jealousy.
To question with pertness; to appear consequential; to be dignified.
To set up for or assume what does not belong to one; hoolili ko Oahu e hookolokolo i ko Lahaina.
To undulate, as the air under a hot sun; to undulate, as the surface of water by the skipping of fishes.
Var. of hoʻīlina.
Caus/sim of liliʻu. Ka hoʻoliliʻu ʻana a ke aloha (chant), the burning love.
To engineer genetically. Comb. hoʻo- + liliuewe. See liliuewe. Ka hoʻoliliuewe ʻana. Genetic engineering.
To adapt biologically. Comb. hoʻo- + liliuwelo. See liliuwelo. Malele hoʻoliliuwelo. Adaptive radiation.

Expense, expenditure; to spend; to lose; to buy or sell. Nui ka hoʻolilo, great expense; very expensive. Ka mea hoʻolilo liʻiliʻi, retail buyer. Nui ka hoʻolilo o ke aupuni no kēlā alanui hou, the government spent much on that new road.

To transfer, assign, as in legal transactions; to export; change, reduction, as in fractions. Waiwai hoʻolilo, exports. Hoʻolilo ʻana, loss, cession. Ua hoʻolilo ʻia i ʻAmelika, become Americanized. Ua hoʻolilo ʻoia iāia iho i kanaka pono, he changed himself into a righteous man.
See lilo 1, 3.
See LILO, to pass from one to another. To cause a transfer; to change from one to another; to be lost; to deliver from one to another.

To change something into a different form or product. Ua hoʻolilo ke keiki i ka ʻili lāʻau i pepa. The child changed the bark into paper. Dic., exi. mng. Kānāwai hoʻolilo mokuʻāina. Admission act, statehood act.
Ham. To take the time (to do something). Also hoʻokaʻawale i ka manawa.
Deficit spending. Lit. spend excessively. See lilo pākeu.
Street name.

To rent, hire, employ, lease, charter; paid, hired; a lease, rental. Hoʻolimalima hou, sublease. Ka mea hoʻolimalima, lessee, tenant. ʻĀina hoʻolimalima, leased land. Kanaka hoʻolimalima, hired man. Kaʻa hoʻolimalima, hired car, taxi. Hoʻolimalima manawa pau ʻole, perpetual lease. Hoʻolimalima no ka manawa e ola ana, life-time lease. He hoʻolimalima makahiki haʻahaʻa, minimum annual rent.
See limalima.
A person hired to work.
See LIMA, hand. To make a bargain; to hire; to buy or sell.
To scar.
See HOOLEINA and HOOLENA.
See LINA and LINALINA, to be tough. To be tough and hard, like wax or gum.
To be smoothed or polished.
Caus/sim of ʻoliʻoli.
For hooolioli. To cause to rejoice; to make glad; to be cheerful; to be joyous.
To be dazzling with brightness. See OLI.
Caus/sim of liʻoliʻo.
To dazzle with brightness.
To prepare.
See LIULIU, a long time. To cause time to be long; to lengthen out time.
To stay or delay a long time in a place.
To get ready; to prepare to do a thing.
To cause a delay, prolong, procrastinate.
See LIULIU, a long time. To cause time to be long; to lengthen out time.
To stay or delay a long time in a place.
To get ready; to prepare to do a thing.
Street name.
To stretch, extend, prolong, lengthen.
See LOA, long. To stretch out or extend the arms or legs after being bent. Lit. To make long.
definitions.notes: Note: Hooloa is said to be a Kauai word for hooleiloa.

definitions.dtxt: To obtain, find, get; product, answer, etc.
See LOHA and ALOHA, to love. To be sick; to be weak; to fade; to fail through weakness.
To hang down, as a withering leaf.
To cherish; to fondle; to caress.
To cause or foment a strike or mutiny.

Caus/sim of lohe.; obedient; to mind, heed; attention (a military command). See mea hoʻolohe. Hoʻolohe ʻole, inattentive, not heeding, unreceptive, unresponsive; to disobey. He kanaka hoʻolohe i kauoha, a person obedient to commands.
See lohe, to hear, obey.
See LOHE, to hear. To cause to hear; to turn the attention; to listen; to regard; to obey.
Hālāwai hoʻolohe. Hearing, i.e., a time for presenting official testimony or argument. Also ʻaha hoʻolohe.
Caus/sim of lohelohe. Hoʻolohelohe ʻōlelo, to eavesdrop.
To give ear; to pay attention.
To delay, make slow, detain; to go slowly, procrastinate, dillydally lag.
See LOHI, to be slow. To make slow; to delay; to detain.
Redup. of hoʻolohi. (Kel. 37)
To procrastinate; to postpone.
To lengthen, extend, prolong.
See LOIHI, long. To lengthen out; to prolong.
To ask the lawyer; to show off knowledge; to ask bewildering questions as a lawyer might.
Street name.
To bring about unity; to make peace and unity; to be in agreement.
To crisscross; to cross.
To outline, as a summary of topics and subtopics using letters and numbers in headings. Comb. hō- + ʻolokeʻa. See ʻolokeʻa.
To insinuate; to suggest as a sport.
To send; to order away.
To dance; to play; to rejoice.
To pour, as rain; to disturb; agitated.
Redup. of hoʻoloku.
Caus/sim of lola.
To be dull; to be stupid; to be indolent; to be unable to accomplish anything; to neglect.
Caus/sim of lolalola.
Freq. of hoolola.
Caus/sim of lole.
See LOLE, skin of an animal. To turn; to change; to turn outside in.
To skin, as an animal. See also LOLI.
To change, convert, exchange, alter, transform, take a new form, amend; amendment, change.
See loli, to change.
See LOLI, to change. To change; to alter; to renew; to take a new form.
To change one thing for another.
To edit, as on a computer. See pākuʻi hoʻololi and entries under hoʻoponopono.

example_txt.txt: constitutional initiative, i.e., a process by which one can propose an amendment by gathering signatures on a petition

definitions.dtxt: Caus/sim of lolia.
Caus/sim of loliloli. See ex., kaʻina.
See LOLI. To rectify; to change; to reform.
To pretend paralysis, stupidity; to pretend to be asleep.
To lengthen.

To listen carefully; to strain the ear to hear. He aliʻi ʻo ka lani, he moʻopuna na Lono, he hiapo na ke kini, hoʻololohe ua (chant), the heavenly one is a chief, a descendant of Lono, the first-born of a multitude [of long lineage], a listener to the rain [unafraid of rain because of high rank].
Caus/sim lolohe.
See LOHE. To be sour and to act roughly.
To be harsh in one’s speech and behavior.
To refuse compliance with one’s invitation; to refuse all approaches; to be disobedient. Laieik. 65.
Similar to hoʻolohi. (FOR. 5:553)
Same as above. Me ka hoʻololoiāhili ʻole aku, without further digression.
Caus/sim lolōiele. Hoʻololōiele kāna hana ʻana, he works so slowly.
To listen, hear, obey; obedient, attentive. Kuʻi ka lono i Pelekane, hoʻolono ke kuini o Palani (song), the news spread to England, the queen of France heard.
See lono 1.
See LONO, kindred with lohe. To regard; to listen to; to obey; to keep.
Redup. of hoʻolono.
To delay, cause to loiter.
See ʻolopū.
To hook, catch with a hook; to put on a hook, as bait. ʻO ka limu kala ka maunu e hoʻolou ai i ka makau (FS 143), kala (seaweed) was the bait placed on the hook.
See LOU, a hook. To hook; to pull with a hook; to draw tight; to bind on; to insert, as one thing into another.
Caus/sim of loʻu.; to droop.
Caus/sim of loua.
See LOU and LOUA, a hook. To hook; to pull with a hook; to pull; to bind on.
To bend over; to stoop in grief or sorrow; to cry; to weep; to be afflicted.
Street name.
To make soft, limber, pleasant, cool, comfortable; to comfort, please, satisfy, pacify.
See ʻolu, cool.
To bake in the oven. Cf. hoʻolua under lua 3 and kālua. Puaʻa hoʻolua, pork and taro tops baked in ti leaves, called laulau today.
To do twice, repeat, do over and over; to bake twice, as food in the oven.

Name of a strong, north wind associated with Makaiwa, Kauaʻi; Hāna, Maui; and Hālawa, Molokaʻi. At Hālawa the name may be qualified by Iho, Kaʻi, Kele, Pehu, Wahakole (Nak. 69). Hoʻolua nui, big Hoʻolua wind; Fig. To talk loudly and to no purpose.
See lua 1, 3, and -lua.
The name of the strong north wind; he ua kahi hoolua, a he ua ole kahi hoolua, some strong winds have rain, others not.
The name of the rain accompanying the north wind; he ua hoolua, he ua nui no ia.
Strong; rough; muscular; he hoolua nui ke kuaaina, he hoopepehu.
See LUA, two; twice. To do twice; to repeat; to do over again.
Specifically, to bake over; to cook twice.
To stop up a pathway that had been common.
See luʻa.
To act or dress like an old lady; to try to be like one.
Emetic; causing vomiting; to cause a vomiting, to feign vomiting; to gag; to drive out people.
See LUAI, to vomit. To vomit; to cast out of the stomach.
To cast out, as a people; to drive off.
Caus/sim of luaiele. Hoʻoluaiele i ka manaʻo (Cleghorn 59), distressing the thoughts.
To be deceitful; e hoopunipuni; to go here and there; to move about often.
Redup. of hoʻoluaʻi.
See LUAI, vomit. To raise the cud, as ruminating animals; to raise again.
To use means to provoke vomiting; a hoolualuai aku la, a pau loa ka awa i ka luaiia. Laieik. 208.
See LUE, to overthrow. To overthrow; to cast down; to cause to slide away; to hang down.
To bring forth many young, as a woman that has borne many children; as a hen that hatches many chickens.
To slack.

chants.chtran: Ease and lower the mount of taboo, then appreciate the beauty of Puna.
chants.chtxt: Hōʻoluea Mauna Kapu a haʻahaʻa, a laila ʻoe ʻike i ka nani o Puna.

definitions.dtxt: See mīkini hōʻolu ea.
A gown; a loose dress; a flowing robe, so called from its looseness.
Hanging low and loosely.
To cast down; to loosen; to throw away; to be loose, as a garment.
Caus/sim of luhe.
To be proud; to act haughtily.
To wither, as a leaf; to be weak; to hang down.
To hang loosely; to be flexible with weakness.

To bother, disturb, trouble, wear out with work, overburden, inconvenience; nuisance, bother; burdensome, demanding, Cf. hale hoʻoluhi. Hana luhi, boring or strenuous labor, toil. Hiki anei iaʻu ke hoʻoluhi iā ʻoe, may I trouble you [a polite preface to a request].
See luhi 1.
See LUHI, fatigue. To make weary; to oppress; to make one work hard; to overbear.
To oppress, harass, burden to no use.
To oppress; to harass; to burden wrongfully.
To make tired, disturbed, etc.; to wear one down with work. Cf. hoʻoluhi.
Freq. of luhi. To force one to do many kinds of much hard work.
To overturn the decision of a council.
The correct spelling may be hooluʻi (see luʻi).**
See LULE, often SYN. with luli, to turn; to shake. To turn; to turn round; to change.
To shake, as flesh with fatness; to be loose.
A trembling; the state of old age.
To cause a trembling or shaking.
To rock, as a child; to shake, as a drink; to sway. Cf. mōhai hoʻoluli.
See luli, to shake.
See LULI, to vibrate; to shake. See LULE above. To rock; to vibrate; to cause a motion back and forth.
Redup. of hoʻoluli; to agitate. Waiū hoʻoluliluli, milk shake.
See LULI, to rock, roll, etc. To stir up; to awake one out of sleep; to disturb one’s quiet; to rock, as a child in a cradle; to agitate.
Street name.

To lie quietly in calm water, as a ship in port; to be calm; to gather together, as objects, or to wait, as for transportation, See kahua hoʻolulu. Kiʻi lāʻau hoʻolulu (KAM. 64:18), fixed wooden images [as at Hale o Keawe]. Hale hoʻolulu, depot, waiting station. Hoʻolulu lei, to offer leis on an altar; the prayer uttered while making an offering of leis; Lit. to make leis repose in peace and quiet.
To chum, for fish; this type of fishing and fisherman.
See LULU, quiet; calm. To lie quietly and still in the water, as a ship in a harbor; to be calm.
See lumi hoʻolulu.

Land division, Kona, Hawaiʻi. Valley and stream, northwest coast, Kauaʻi. (UL 118) Street, Kapahulu, Honolulu, named by Auhea Crowningburg, owner of the tract, for her ancestor, who may have hidden the bones of Kamehameha near Kaloko, Hawaiʻi (RC 215). (TM)
To make sleepy; drowsy. Mele hoʻoluluhi, lullaby.
The heavy and dark clouds gathering before a storm; thickening atmosphere before a storm.
See LUHI, weary with labor. To cause the eyes to be heavy with sleep; to be drowsy; to be sleepy.
Same as hoʻoluʻuluʻu; to cause to bend down, to load heavily. Pākaukau i hoʻoluluʻu pū me nā mea ʻai, tables laden down with food.
To fertilize, as an egg. Hoʻolūmaua ʻia nā kowaū a ka ʻoʻopu wahine e ke kāne. The female ʻoʻopu’s eggs are fertilized by a male. Comb. hoʻo- + lūmaua. See lūmaua.
To appoint as foreman, officer, etc.; to act as officer.
See LUNA, an officer; an overseer. To be or act as an officer; to be in authority over others.
To stir up or order men to their duties; to act the luna.
See HOOLULI. Weak; shaky; applies to persons or things where there is weakness.
Street name.
Redup. of hōʻolu; to satisfy, alleviate, allay, console; to retire to rest, to seek rest; parade rest, at ease (military commands). E hōʻoluʻolu mai i kō ʻoukou mau naʻau, comfort your hearts.
See ʻoluʻolu.
For hoooluolu. See OLU and OLUOLU, to please; to comfort. To make easy; to quiet; to comfort; to be cool.
To cause to flourish; lush. See nupanupa.
Street name.

To dip, immerse, dye. Hoʻoluʻu ʻili, to tan hides. Hoʻoluʻu paʻakai, basket for storing salt (paʻakai); to dye salt with ocherous earth. Waihoʻoluʻu, color dye. Poʻe hoʻoluʻu, dye makers. Hoʻoluʻu lahilahi, to dye lightly, tint.
See luʻu, to dive.
See LUU, to dive in the water. To plunge in a liquid; hence, to dye; to color.
Palai hoʻoluʻu. To deep-fry.
Pas/imp. of hoʻoluʻu. Pāʻū noʻenoʻe i hoʻoluʻua, dyed printed skirts.
To tan skins.
A tanner of skins or hides.
definitions.notes: Note: A later edition has hanaili instead of hooluuili.

definitions.dtxt: See HOOLUU and ILI, a skin or hide. To tan hides.
To cause sorrow, grief; to oppress, load down.
Redup. of hoʻoluʻu; to set a fish trap.
The act of taking or catching fish in a basket.
Applied to a fish basket; hinai hooluuluu.
See LUU, to dive. To fish for the fish called hinalea; to dive and take fish in a basket.
Ike i ka ulana moena ame ka hooluupaakai.
Caus/sim of mā.
See MA, to fade; to wilt. To cause to fade; to wilt, as a flower; to perish.
To strike with the hands or paddle, as a man on a surf-board.
Same as hoʻoʻoma. Koʻi hōʻoma, chisel.
To practice, gain experience or skill, become accustomed (less used than hoʻomaʻamaʻa).
See MAA, to accustom. To accustom; to practice; to exercise by practice.
To be ready for any business by having experience in it.
To adapt to. See maʻa.
To capitalize (a letter of the alphabet). Comb. hoʻo- + maʻaka. See hoʻonaʻinaʻi. Kaha hoʻomaʻaka. Three lines drawn under a letter to indicate that the letter is to be capitalized, in proofreading.
Same as hoʻomākeʻaka, to cause laughter.
See AKAAKA, to laugh. To cause laughter; to make sport; to play a trick; to say that which is not true.
To simplify, as in a math problem. Comb. hoʻo- + maʻalahi.
Caus/sim of maʻalea.
See MAALEA, cunning. To act wisely; to act craftily; to act deceitfully; to be lazy.
See ALI, a scar. To make the trace of a thing, as the wake of a ship; to make a faint track of a person walking; to make a slight road; to appear, as the scar of a wound.
Street name.
To cause to cool; appease, soothe, quiet, pacify, assuage anger or grief.
See MALILI and MAALILI, to assuage; to cool. To assuage heat; to cool; to pacify, as anger.
Same as hoʻomaʻa; to practice, become accustomed; to train, drill.
See maʻamaʻa.
See MAA, to accustom. To accustom one to work; to teach one to work; to be furnished; to be ready for business.
To practice. Puke hoʻomaʻamaʻa haʻawina. Practice book. Also puke hoʻomaʻamaʻa.
To become accustomed, familiar.
Beginning. (Kep. 175)
To persecute, offend, injure, bully, tease, torment.
A tempting; a trial as to one’s constancy. Laieik. 102.
See MAAU, to trouble. To defend off; to take an oath; to make a law.
To persecute; to injure maliciously; to offend; to hate; to dislike.
To follow from affection.
To go from place to place.
To be indifferent; to neglect.
To mimic speech in a nasty way, to mock, annoy thus.
To laugh at, ridicule, mock; to disregard.
See MAAU and EA. To work lazily; to leave one’s work unfinished.
Var. of hoʻomāʻauē.
To make a tracing; footprint, track, slight path; to make small fibers or threads.
See maʻawe, fibre.
See MAAWE, a small indefinite part. To divide out in small quantities.
Frequentative of the foregoing.
To cause to wilt, fade; to fade.
See HOOMA and MAE, to wilt; to fade. To cause to wilt, as a leaf; to wither; to dry, as a vegetable; to blast; to fade, as colored cloth; to hang down, as a wilting vegetable.
Short for hoʻomakaʻē.
To disregard; to turn a deaf ear to; to refuse to listen. See HOONALULU.
To cause numbness, shock, great love.
See MAEELE. To pity; to have one’s sympathy excited; ua hoomaeeleia ka naau o ko lakou kaikunane i ke aloha. Laieik. 74.
To anesthetize. Redup. of hoʻomāʻele. Lāʻau hoʻomā- ʻeʻele. Anesthetic.
Same as hoʻoʻeha.
To dare; to provoke; to be boisterous.
Caus/sim of māʻele.
See MAE, to fade. To wilt, as a leaf; to fade, as the colors of cloth; to dry up.
To cleanse; to purify; to clear away filth or stench.
Street name.
To clean, cleanse, purge, disinfect, purify. ʻAoʻao hoʻomaʻemaʻe, reform party.
See maʻemaʻe.
See lāʻau hoʻomaʻemaʻe hale.
To reproach, sneer at, mimic, ridicule, desecrate, jeer, mock, scorn.
See MAEWA, to mock. To mock; to mimic; to reproach; to provoke.
Redup. of hoʻomaʻewa; to purge oneself of the effects of black magic by performing a prescribed humiliating ceremony, as walking about naked.
See the above. To reproach; to sneer at; to ridicule.
Street name.

Vacation; to take a rest or vacation; to retire, stop work; to obtain relief; to pause; rest in music (types are hoʻomaka poʻo, a whole rest; hoʻomaha poʻoʻele, a quarter rest; hoʻomaha poʻolima, a half rest; hoʻomaha poʻomana, an eighth rest; hoʻomaha poʻomanalua, a sixteenth rest; hoʻomaha poʻomanakolu, a thirty-second rest). Ua hoʻomaha nā kula, the schools are having a vacation. Hoʻomaha ʻia mai au i kuʻu hāʻawe, I am relieved of my burden. Hoʻomaha ai ma nā kānāwai (FOR. 6:159), to rest with the laws [obey them].
See maha, rest.
See MAHA, rest. To cause to rest from fatigue or pain; to cease from exertion.
Intermission.

example_txt.txt: halftime, as in sports or games
time out, in team sports such as volleyball

definitions.dtxt: Rest, in music. See entries below.
Way, Mānoa, Honolulu.
To prepare soil for gardening, to make earth soft and fine.
To place taro tops together until they begin to sprout and are ready for planting (perhaps a contraction of hoʻomaka hāhā, to start stems).
See HAHA, the inside of kalo tops. To throw the small refuse kalo roots on the side of the kalo patch.
Quarter rest, in music.
Thirty-second rest, in music.
Half rest, in music.
Sixteenth rest, in music.
Eighth rest, in music.
To trace, as a picture. Niʻihau, from māka.
Caus. of mahakea.
To loosen; to unravel; to clear up or vindicate one’s character.
Caus/sim of mahamaha.
Street name.
To warm, create warmth, heat.
See mahana 1.
Vacation, rest.
See MAHANA, warm, also MEHANA. To cause to be warm; to warm by the fire or by the sun.
To make warm, heat.
To relax rigor of taboo during a long rigorous session. (Malo 160, 176)
Name of one of the last kapus; kakali iho la oia i pau ka hoomahanahana, a neenee aku.
Freq. of hoʻomahana.
Whole rest, in music.
To have a division made, distribute, divide, etc.
Caus/sim of mahele.
To lead conversation towards a topic. ʻO ʻAlamila e hoʻomāhele ma kona kamaʻilio ʻana no nā mea e pili ana no ʻEnelani, Almira in her chatting led the conversation to things pertaining to England.
To build, in math. E hoʻomāhele i kēia haʻi hōʻailona helu. Build this algebraic expression (i.e., by showing its separate steps). Cf. hoʻomakala.
Street name.
Delightful, charming; to cast shy glances, as of a coy child.
See HIE, pride, and HOOHIE. To be excellent; to be grand; to be noble in appearance.
To be proud; to have a high look.
To cause to leap, jump, etc.
Street name.
To beautify, adorn, bedeck, Cf. hiluhilu.
Caus. of māhinu.
Caus/sim of mahola.; to unroll.
See MAHOLA, to open, as a flower. To spread out smoothly, as clothes or kapa. See HOLA.
To open; to spread open; to expand, as a flower.

To expand or explode, as a file in a computer program; to extend, as a math problem which can be extended into other similar problems or situations. E hoʻomahola i kēia waihona. Expand this file. E hoʻomahola aʻe i kēia polopolema ma ka haku ʻana i kekahi mau polopolema ʻano like. Extend this problem by making up some similar problems. Comb. hoʻo-+ mahola. See mahola, ʻopi, ʻopihia.
Freq. of the foregoing.
The different forms mahola and mohala have the same meaning.
To create steam; to cook or soften food by steam; to steam.
See MAHU, steam; vapor. To steam; to burst forth like steam.
To behave like a homosexual or hermaphrodite.
To mock; to spy, watch, as a cat watching a mouse.
To watch; to lie in wait; to act as a spy secretly; to mock; to deride.
To hide one’s self; to conceal from view; to dodge behind something.
To increase, expand, enlarge, multiply, grow. Hoʻomāhua i kona waiwai, to increase its value, wealth. Hoʻomāhua ke aniani hoʻonui ʻike i ka pūpū, the microscope magnifies the shell.
See māhua.
To increase; to grow in size; to swell out; more often used in the double form, as.

To bring bad luck, misfortune; to annoy, distress, harm; adversity. Hoʻomāhuā i nā hoa noho, to mistreat the people one lived with. He hōʻailona hoʻomāhuā ka makapaʻa, a one-eyed person is a sign of bad luck.
Caus/sim of māhuahua.; to enlarge.
See MAHUA and HUA, to grow. To increase; to enlarge; to grow big.
To show disbelief, skepticism; to ridicule, mock, as beliefs.
To jeer at; to treat with contempt.
Caus/sim of mahuʻi.
Caus/sim of māhuʻi.; to mimic. Poʻe kumu lā, i hoʻomahuʻi ʻia ai e kēlā poʻe, teachers imitated by that people.
See MAHUI, to follow after. To follow after; to imitate; to listen to one’s counsel or advice; to imitate one’s example.
To chase, drive away, assist or help to escape.
See MAHUKA, to run away. To counsel or advise one to run away; to assist one to leave a place or business secretly; to hide one’s self to avoid work.
Caus/sim of māhukahuka.
To be blind, especially with one eye.
To cause or feign sickness.
See MAI, sickness, and MAE. To cause sickness; to be weak; to be out of health.
See MAIHA, to be energetic. To draw firmly, as a rope; to be intent upon, as the mind; to pursue eagerly.
To be strong; to be intent upon.
Street name.

example_txt.txt: ʻO wau nō me ka hoʻomaikaʻi
I am very gratefully yours [in conclusion of a letter]

definitions.dtxt: To thank, bless, render thanks, congratulate, make acceptable, praise, improve, perfect, correct; grateful, gratified, thankful. See inu hoʻomaikaʻi, palapala hoʻomaikaʻi, pule hoʻomaikaʻi.
See maikaʻi, good.
See above. Thanksgiving. Honor. A blessing. Favor; respect; admiration.
See MAIKAI, handsome; good. To make good; to correct; to make handsome.
To bless; to ascribe goodness to one; to make prosperous.
To praise. Cf. hanohano. See English entry honors. Me ka hoʻomaikaʻi, With honors, as when graduating from a college or university. Me ka hoʻomaikaʻi nui. With high honors.
Street, ʻĀlewa Heights, Honolulu.
Honor; outward respect paid to a superior.
Caus/sim of māikaika.
See HOOMAIKA. To be strong; to draw firmly.
Street name.
To show.
To show, reveal, make known or comprehensible. He hoʻomāʻikeʻike mai ka pō mai, a revelation from the night [as in a dream]. Mea hoʻomāʻikeʻike, displayed object, curio.
Street name.
Caus/sim of mailani. (FS 137)
To tend, as a child; to take care of; to honor.
To treat mildly when one is discouraged.
To cause thinness. He mea ʻino, hoʻomāilo kino ka ʻopiuma, opium is bad thing that causes the body to waste away.
To pretend to be sickly.
See MAI, sickness. To pretend to be sick; ua hoomaimai ae la oia, a nolaila, ua hala ia po. Laieik. 209.
To cause anger; to anger.
To treat cruelly, abuse, persecute; to cause misery and suffering.
See INO, badness. To make sad; to treat with severity.
Caus/sim of māinoino.; to torture; atrocity.
See MAINOINO, to suffer affliction. To afflict; to treat with severity; to slander; to deride.
To defame, slander, deface.
To furrow, cut in ridges, cause thinness.
Caus/sim of māʻiʻo.
See MA, to fade, and Io, flesh. To grow thin in flesh; to have little flesh on the bones.
To peep like a chicken. See IOIO.
To mar; to spoil.
To cut up; to make marks.
To keep at a distance, avoid.
Street name.
To begin, start, initiate; commence; to appear, of a child’s first tooth; to put forth buds; to come to a head, as a boil. Mea hoʻomaka, beginner.
To begin. See maka 3.
The fresh blade of a plant; the first leaf of a tree.
To begin; to commence a work; to set forth a new thing; to commence, as a course of evil. Laieik. 191.
To be wild; to be untamed; to be evilly disposed.
To begin, start, as a computer program. See haʻalele; hopunaʻōlelo wehe kumuhana, kino, pau. Ka hoʻomaka ʻana. Opening, as of a story.
See MAKAKIU, watchful eye. To spy out; to act the part of a spy; to watch with jealousy.
definitions.notes: Note: This is rather a phrase than a word, to commence to watch.

definitions.dtxt: To hang moist, as undried tapa, over a line or drying rack (haka), so that the edges will correspond and that a fixed crease will form.
Caus/sim of makaʻē. Ua hoʻomakaʻē ka Haku i ka poʻe hana hewa, the face of the Lord is against evildoers.
To look at with disdain; to stand aloof from; to be at enmity with; to look askance or be angry at.
To look at with anger, to avoid looking at because of anger; not to recognize because of anger.
To show signs of clearing. Ke hoʻomākahakaha maila ka ua, there are signs that the rain is clearing.
Caus/sim of makahehi.
Caus/sim of maka hinu.; to conceal annoyance or or anger by pretense of cheerfulness.
To begin again.
To act as a policeman; to appoint or invest as a policeman.
See MAKAI, a policeman. To be bold; to be fearless; to be assuming.
To act the sheriff; to be a policeman.
To be stingy; to be close; to be hard to deal with.
To take others on a visit; to show the sights; to escort.
See mākaʻikaʻi, to visit.
To look at with hatred; to plan revenge or evil.
To beg; to ask.
To design revenge; to meditate mischief.
To spy, watch, reconnoiter.
Jealous; suspicious; watchful through jealousy.
See HOOMAKA and KIU, to spy. To watch with a jealous eye; to lie in wait to do evil.
To make something a priority. Comb. hoʻo- + makakoho. Cf. hoʻokaʻina makakoho. See makakoho.
Caus/sim of makala.
See MAKALA, to loosen. To cause to open a little, as a door; to loosen; to untie. See KALA. To loosen, as in taking off one’s garment.
To undo, in math. Hoʻomakala nā hana hoʻomākalakala huli hope kekahi i kekahi. Inverse operations undo each other. Lit, cause to undo. Cf. hoʻomāhele.

To solve; to decode. Dic., new mng. Also hana a loaʻa ka hāʻina. Cf. hoʻoponopono pilikia. See mākalakala. Hoʻomākalakala i ka polopolema. To solve a problem. Hana hoʻomākalakala. Operation. Hana hoʻomākalakala huli hope. Inverse operation. Kaʻina hoʻomākalakala. Order of operations.
See MAKAMAKA, a friend. To be on terms of intimacy; to make friends for the sake of profit or convenience.
To let a garden grow wild; wild, untamed.
See HOOMAKA and NAHELE, land grown up to bushes. To go astray in the bush; to get out of the road.
To cause blindness, to feign blindness, to blindfold.
To frown, look with disapproval.
To frighten, scare, terrify, make afraid; fear; to pretend to fear.
See makaʻu.
See MAKAU, fear. To cause one to fear; to make afraid; to frighten.
Caus/sim of makaʻua; to frighten, scare.
To hang or fasten up, as clothes to dry.
To prepare, make ready. Hoʻomākaukau ʻia ma kēia kānāwai, provided for by this law.
See mākaukau.
See MAKAUKAU, ready; prepared. To make ready; to prepare; to get in readiness for business or for a coming event.
To scare, frighten; scared, frightened.
Freq. of makau. To make afraid; to try to scare; e lilo ana oe i mea e hoomakaukau ia ai ma na alanui. thou shalt become an example causing fear by the [illegible]oad sides. Laieik. 212.
Preservice teacher training. Lit. prepare teacher. Cf. hoʻoikaika kumu.

To economize; thrifty, saving, economical, frugal; to desire, covet. See ex., kōʻalaʻala. Poʻe hoʻomakauliʻi ʻāina, people eager for land. Ua hoʻokō ʻia ka hana hoʻomakauliʻi i loko o ke aupuni, economies in government have been effected.
To seek every detail; to find out even the smallest things, scrutinize. Cf. ex., kōʻalaʻala.
One who feigns friendship and eats with one while he watches his opportunity to injure him; one acting with cunning and duplicity.
Strong desire for and corresponding effort to obtain a thing.

To be thorough going; to persevere; to hold out; to have a strong desire for a thing; e hoomanawanui a loaa mai; he kanaka hoomakaulii haku, a nolaila e malama pono i ka waiwai; he hoomakaulii ma ka manao i ke Akua.
To treat like a kauā makawela.
To kill. See make, to die.
See MAKE, death. To cause death; to kill.
To wish to die; to fast.
To put in a state of privation; to cause thinness of flesh.
To put one’s self where he would appear to be lost; mai hoopae oe (i ka aina), e hoomake oe i kou nalu, go not ashore, plunge under your surf.

example_txt.txt: funny antics; to do something to provoke laughter

definitions.dtxt: Witty, comic, funny, amusing; to cause laughter, exercise wit or humor.
Funny. See mākeʻaka.
Exciting laughter; witty; he olelo hoomakeaka.
See AKA, to laugh. To excite laughter; to exercise wit.
Funny, humorous, witty.
Caus/sim of makeʻe.
To be greedy after property; to scrape together; to lust after property.
To accuse falsely; to do a thing in vain.
Resentful.
To cause or feign desire.
See MAKEMAKE. To desire; to wish for.
See MAKENA. To cause mourning; to cause sorrow; to cause grief.
See KIU, to spy. To watch with a design to surprise; to watch for an opportunity to do mischief.
Street name.
To act bravely.
To walk, talk or act bravely; to act as an officer among soldiers; e hookoa, e hookalali.
To be hard; to be stingy; to be close; to be regardless of others.
To cause redness or soreness of the eyes.
See mākole 1.
To prepare octopus that is slightly decomposed.
See mākole 2.
See KOLE and MAKOLE, red, as raw flesh. To be raw, as flesh; to be red, as inflamed eyes.
To cut into small bits, to render small or fine.
See KOLI, to trim; to cut short. To cut short; to make small; to render fine.
Large, billowy; to increase, enlarge.
The epithet of a cloud; he ao hoomakomako, a large cloud, perhaps.
To act mean, hard, etc.
See MAKOU, to be red, as the eyes. To make red; to be blood shot, as the eyes from being long in salt water.
To cause to harden, solidify, thicken, gel; to lower, as clouds. Fig. To show off.
To increase; to grow large; to grow thickly.
To grow; to enlarge; to become thick or many.
To act as or claim to be a makuahine; to treat as a makuahine.
To act as or claim to be a makuakāne; to address or treat as a makuakāne.
An angry look; a frowning at; a stirring up of displeasure.
To burden one; to vex; to trouble; to be angry at; to frown at.
To frown; to frown at one.
Caus. of hoʻomākulukulu.
See HOOMAKU. To increase; to enlarge; to grow fat; to be heavy, as a fat person or animal.
To cause such aching.
To feign friendship.
To clear, explain clearly; to calm, cheer, dispel gloom; to clear away, as brush or weeds.
See MALAE, to be calm. To put on a pleasant countenance; to assume the appearance of friendship when the heart is disaffected; to hide an evil design by assuming pleasaentry.
Pas/imp. of hoʻomālaʻe.
To be calm; to be quiet; to settle down in quietness; applied to the presence of one who was reproached when absent.
Caus/sim of mālaʻelaʻe.
See laʻelaʻe, clear, as the sky. To enlighten; to make clear and pleasant; to calm.
Pass. for malaia to be bitter. To make bitter; to be bitter.
To cause sourness; to embitter.
See MALAILENA, bitterness. To make bitter; to embitter.
To leave so as to sour, as mashed sweet potato to be eaten as poi; to ferment.
To light, as a set for a movie or video production. Luna hoʻomālamalama. Lighting director.
To cause light, brighten, illuminate, enlighten, inform, civilize.
See mālamalama 1.
See LAMA, a torch. To enlighten; to shine upon.
To make buoyant, lighten.
To throw away, as refuse matter.
To be disrespected.
To take care of.
To be large; to swell, as a dead body.
Freq. of hoʻomālana.
To act the idler; to be a vagabond; to go about from place to place doing nothing.
See MALAU, to reject good advice. To be unbelieving; to be ungodly; to be irreverent towards sacred things.
To be lazy; to be indolent. See MALAO.
Caus/sim of malauea.
To perform the marriage ceremony, to marry off; to force into marriage.
See MALEA and MAALEA, wise; crafty. To deal wisely; to be crafty; to act wisely or prudently.
To scatter, distribute.
To distribute, as in delivering or making publications available to the public. Cf. kākaʻahi.
Street name.
To calm, quiet, hush, soothe, lull, ease pain.
See MALIE, calm; quiet. To hush, as a tumult; to clear off, as the sky after a storm.
To comfort one who is disturbed, to soothe; to slow down. Hoʻomalielie i ke kaumaha, condolence.
To appease, as a ruffled mind; to soothe; to calm, as anger; to treat kindly.

definitions.der: [PCP man(i,u)(f,s)i(l,n)i; PEP if Easter manihini is not a Tahitian loan]
definitions.dtxt: To be or act as a stranger, guest; to reveal that guests are coming, as by omens. Ke hoʻomalihini mai nei kahi moa a kākou, our chicken reveals that guests are coming.
See MALIHINI, a stranger. To make one’s self a stranger; to become a stranger; to be foreign to one.
To discredit.
Caus/sim of mālili. E hoʻomālili ai ka ʻenaʻena, to appease the anger.
Street name.
To flatter, wheedle; to mollify with soft words or a gift; to soothe, quiet.
See malimali.
See MALIMALI, to flatter. To flatter; to secure one’s favor by flattery.
Street name.
To cause to heed, heed. Hoʻomaliu ʻia aku ke Akua, God was entreated.
To make straight, firm, as a cord or sail; to tighten.
To stretch, as for warming up before exercise.

example_txt.txt: E aho ʻoe e hoʻomālō ma mua o ka hoʻokūkū i ʻole ai e huki ke aʻa.
You'd better stretch before the game so that you don't pull a muscle.
neck stretches, i.e., a warm-up exercise for sports such as volleyball; also to do this exercise
banding tool, as for putting metal bands on boxes, water tanks, etc.; see kalapu hao

definitions.dtxt: Caus/sim of māloʻeloʻe.
To stretch, make taut.
Sluggish; to act drowsy, sleepy; to cause drowsiness, sleepiness.
See LOHI, to be slow. To be fatigued, as by traveling; to be lame. See MALUHILUHI.
