To feed a sick person with the fruit of the noni, which makes one sick.
Same as hoʻopiʻoloke. He mea hou hoʻopīʻōʻō, disturbing news.
To pipe on a flute-like instrument.

Redup. of hoʻopiʻo; a form of imitative magic in which the practitioner, while concentrating, touched a part of his own body, thereby causing injury to his victim’s body in the same place, as a chest pain or headache. If the intended victim saw the gestures, he might imitate them and thereby send the black magic back to the original practitioner. Both practices were hoʻopiʻopiʻo.
To practice sorcery, a part of which was the auhauhui and hiu. See ANAANA. To pray in the practice of sorcery. To perform other ceremonies with medicines, etc., in order to kill.
definitions.notes: Note: The god to whom the prayer was made was called Pua.

definitions.dtxt: Caus/sim of pipī. to smoke, as ham. Kinai i ka ʻuwiki e hoʻopipī ana, quench a smoldering wick.
To cause to sprinkle, urinate.
Same as hoʻopiʻipiʻi; to set a high price. Wai hoʻopipiʻi, charged water.
To go here and there; to stagger.
To wander; to go into an inclosure.
To go wrong in advance.
To cause to shrink, clamp.
Same as hoʻopilipili; to paste, glue, stick. Mea hoʻopipili, paste.
To put close together; to squint. Kanu hoʻopipipi i nā ʻanoʻano, plant the seeds close together.
See PO, night; dark. To act in the dark. Fig. To do ignorantly.
To give without discretion; to act foolishly without intelligence; e hoonaaupo, e hoonalowale.

To absent one’s self slily, as if in the dark; i kekahi manawa, ike ia mai lakou i ka pule, a i kekahi manawa, hoopo loa aku, sometimes they appear at worship, at other times they make themselves dark.
To keep out of one’s sight.
To be willingly blind or ignorant.
To encircle, surround, besiege, etc.
To recycle. Comb. hoʻo- + pōʻaiapuni. See pōʻaiapuni.
To round; to form into a round shape, as a loaf of bread. Pipi hoʻopoe, meat ball. ʻOki hoʻopoe, to cut the hair evenly on all sides.
See POEPOE, round. To cut off short; to cut off square, as pieces of sugar-cane or pieces of wood.
To cut the hair alike all over the head.
To make globular.
Caus/sim of poehi.
See hoʻopoe above. To make round; to collect into a ball.
To shorten endways.
To cut off, as a section of a log for a cart wheel.
See pohā, to burst; to break. To cause to break or burst forth, as a sound.
To burst, as the contents of a boil; to overflow.
To flow away.
To tear, as a hole in cloth.
See pōhae. To cause to tear; to tear open.
To remain long in one place; to stay at home. E hoʻopōhaku, e noho mālie (chant), stay, rest quietly.
See pōhaku, a stone; a rock. To become a stone or rock; to harden; to become as a rock or stone; to be very hard.
To discredit, not believe, depreciate. To clarify. To revive, etc.
A pretense; a specious course of conduct.
See POHALA, to recover from sickness. To rest; to be quiet; to recover from sickness.
To prevent or dissuade one from giving his consent to a bargain or proposition.
To object to; to speak against.
To make a hole or crevice; to split; to crack; to burst forth; to swell up, as a wound; to be large.
To squeeze out.
To round, smooth, or shape into a knob (insulting: see pōheo).
To make a head on the end of a stick or other substance, as in making the neck on the top of a rafter on a native house; e kalai ia luna o na oa, a uuku, a hoopoheoheo ia ko luna o na oa.
To confuse, bewilder, puzzle, make mysterious.
Caus/sim of poho.
To cause a loss, fail; to sell at a loss.
To bruise, skin, peel, etc. Cf. hole 1.
Caus/sim of pohopoho.
Street name.
To calm, quiet; to bring into a calm, as a ship. Hoʻokō i nā kuko haumia apau a kona naʻau e hoʻopohu ai (Kep. 67), satisfy all the filthy lusts of his heart so they are calmed.
See poʻi, to examine by torture. To cause to be awake; to excite; to stir up.
To examine by torture or threats.
To cause to forget; same as above. Ua hoʻopoina ʻoe i ke Akua, you have forgotten God.
See poina, to forget. To cause to forget; to be unmindful; to be indifferent as to business or knowledge; to be thoughtless.

To harm, injure, distress, devastate; to cause misfortune, distress, damage. Hoʻopōʻino malū, secret bringing of misfortune, sabotage. Hale e hiki ʻole ai ke hoʻopōʻino ʻia e ke ahi, fireproof houses.
See POINO, to be in distress. To be ill-fated; to be unlucky; to be in distress.
To be filthy; to be unclean.
Caus/sim of poʻipoʻi.
Freq. of hoʻopoʻi. To smother, as a fire: to extinguish.
Same as hoʻopokakaʻa; to overwhelm, bewilder with a succession of tasks.
To spin, roll, coil, revolve; to repeat the same story over and over.
See POKAKAA, the wheel of a pulley. To turn, as the wheel of a pulley; to cause to roll, as a wheel.
To go over and over again with the same story, as a verbose speaker.
To shorten, cut short, abbreviate; contraction. Hoʻopōkole ʻana, abbreviation.
See POKOLE and PAKOLE, short. To shorten; to cut short; to curtail the length of a thing.
See POKO, short. To make short; to curb in: to cut short.
To cure, make get well; to fill out, as after sickness.
See POLAPOLA, to sprout. To push or urge on.
To revive or come to, as one sick.
To sprout; to push out, as a bud; to quicken; to hasten on.
Beginning of dusk; to become dark.
Caus/sim of poloke. Hoʻopoloke i ka manaʻo, to change the mind.
To straighten, correct, reform; to aim, as a gun; to be partial and treat with favoritism. Kula hoʻopololei keiki kāne, boys' reform school.
See POLOLEI, straight. To make straight; to straighten; to correct; to make corrections; to put to rights.
Pihi hoʻopololei. Adjuster, as on triple-beam balance scales.
See pōloli, hunger. To cause hunger; to fast; to eat no food.
The dark gathering of clouds before a storm.
See POLULUHI, dark; foggy. To cover the sky with dark storm clouds; to thicken and darken, as clouds before a storm.
To cause good fortune; to bless, improve, ask grace; blessing.
See POMAIKAI, fortunate. To make one fortunate; to be fortunate in obtaining what one wishes; to be blessed.
To confuse, bewilder.
To cause blight.
Caus/sim of pōnalonalo.
See nalo and pōnalonalo, to obscure. To appear dimly as scarcely discernible; to be obscure to the sight; to be vanishing.
To soil, besmirch.
See above and pōniu, dizziness. To be dizzy; to have the sensation of a turning of the head; to turn or whirl like a top.
See PONI, purple color. To be of a black or deep blue color.
To have a mixture of colors; to be purple.
To revolve, spin.
Caus/sim of pōniuniu.
See pōniu, vertigo. To have a dizziness of the head.
Street name.
See PONO, good; right. To rectify: to put in order; to make correct; to do rightly.
To correct. See ponopono 1.
See hoʻopono. To rule over; to be a superintendent.
To put in order; to regulate; to correct what is erroneous.
See entries below. Pukaaniani hoʻoponopono. Edit screen, in a computer program.
To decorate sets, as for a movie or video production. Mea hoʻoponopono kahua, Set decorator.
To edit sound, as for a movie or video production. Cf. kani keaka. Luna hoʻoponopono kani. Sound editor.
To edit, as movies or movie productions. Lit. edit movies. See hoʻoponopono kani, hoʻoponopono wikiō. Hale hoʻoponopono kiʻiʻoniʻoni. Editing facility (for movies).
To style hair, as for a play, movie, or video production. Mea hoʻoponopono lauoho. Hair stylist.
To solve a problem, i.e., resolve a difficulty. Cf. huli hāʻina, ʻimi hāʻina. See hoʻomākalakala.
To edit, as videos or video productions. Lit. edit videos. See hoʻoponopono kani, hoʻoponopono kiʻiʻoniʻoni. Hale hoʻoponopono wikiō. Editing facility (for videos).
To appoint a head or leader; to go ahead; to be brave. Lele hoʻopoʻo aʻela ka ua (FOR. 6:240), the rain falls headlong.
To dig, dub out.
See poʻo, the head. To go ahead; to go forward; not to retrograde.
To be brave; to hold fast.
Redup. of hoʻopoʻo.
See poʻopoʻo, deep. To be deep; to dig deep; to sink down.
To cause distress, harm, trouble; to afflict.
Caus/sim of popohe.
Caus/sim of popololei.
See HOOKAKAHELE. To be weak in body; to be unstrung, as the nerves and muscles.
To darken, make dark, blind, mislead; to pretend to be ignorant or not know.

definitions.dtxt: See pouli, darkness. To darken; to make dark.
To blind.
Falls, Hanalei district, Kauaʻi.
Redup. of hoʻopouli; blackout.
To shorten, stoop.
See poupou, short, particularly of stature. To shorten; to make or be short.
Morally, to be low; to be humble.
Caus/sim of powehi.
For hanapu. A mediator for peace or war.
To gather salt; salt gatherer. Kaʻū.
Caus/sim of pū.
See pū or puʻu, to contract into a bunch. To sit shrugged up in one’s kapa or blanket; to shiver with the cold; to sit crumped up in a bunch.
To put to flight, drive in confusion.
See HOOKOHUKOHU and PUAHIAHI. To dress one’s self up finely.
Caus/sim of puahi.
To cause to flow, show, etc.
See puaʻi, to flow, as blood. To vomit; to cast out; to boil up, as a spring.
To appear bright, shine.
A white cloud, or any beautiful distant object.
To appear at a distance as beautiful, desirable.
See PUAI, to flow. To gurgle, as one drinking from a calabash; to boil up, as a spring.
Caus/sim of pue. ʻO ka pua ʻilima i kui ʻia, kaʻu e hoʻopue nei i ka poli (song), the ʻilima blossoms strung in a lei, that I press to my heart. Hoʻopue au i ke koʻekoʻe, I sit huddled up with cold.
Caus/sim of puʻeʻeke.
To scatter, disperse, rout, blow away, whisk, crumble; blown away, fluff; gone.
To chase off, help escape.
To fill with air, inflate.
See PALALU, the snorting of a horse. To imitate the neighing of a horse; to snort like a horse.
To inflate, fill with air. Also puhi a piha. See ʻananuʻu.
Caus/sim of puhalu. to pulverize or loosen, as the soil.
One that acts underhanded; a hypocrite.
To spend time lazily.
To explain language so as to mean nothing.
To object to; to refuse consent to.
To magnify an offense.
To be tough and watery inside; to be inwardly unsound; to be of poor quality.
Caus/sim of pūhanu.
See pūhanu. To rest a little; to breathe soft and easy.
To loosen, release.
To cause to blow, blow. Fig. To steal.

To blow in gusts from varying directions. ʻAʻohe mea nāna e hoʻopūhili, he moho no ka lā makani, there is none to blow [him] aside, for he is a wingless rail [or candidate] of a windy day [admiration for one who lets nothing stop him from carrying out a task].
To confuse, thwart, frustrate.
Caus/sim of pūhiʻu. Lāʻau hoʻopūhiʻu, a medicine for relief of gas pains by flatulency.
To warm by the fire; to cook.
To perfume.
To grow or increase in weight.
See PUIPUI, fat. To become large, fat and fleshy, as the body.

example_txt.txt: me nā mea kani e hoʻopūʻiwa iā ʻoukou
with the instruments to startle you

definitions.dtxt: To startle, astonish, etc.
See pūʻiwa, startled.
See PUIWA, to start suddenly. To be suddenly scared; to frighten one; to be overtaken; to be seized by; ua hoopuiwaia ke alii kane e ke kuko ino. Laieik. 37.

example_txt.txt: E hoʻopuka ʻia ana ka papa i kēia makahiki.
The class will be graduated this year.

definitions.dtxt: To graduate.
To invest; to make a profit; profitable. Cf. waiwai hoʻopuka.

example_txt.txt: to speak out of turn, make a slip of the tongue
to insult, slur, say evil or blasphemous things
kou naʻau e hoʻopuka aku i kekahi mea

definitions.dtxt: To proclaim, speak, say, pronounce.
See puka 1–3.
See PUKA, an opening. To cause to pass through an orifice, as through a doorway or through a hole in a fence, etc.
To make a substance full of holes or chinks.
To appear in sight, as a ship at a distance.
To emerge to light, as from darkness.
To publish, as a newspaper.
To produce, as a movie or video production. See kuhikuhi, manakia hoʻopuka, luna ʻenehana.
To publish, as in a computer program. Cf. loulou. See hoʻopuka hou loa, hoʻopuka hoʻoponopono ʻia.
Lako hoʻopuka. Factors of production, in economics.
Interim or maintenance release, as of a computer program. Lit. cause regulated emergence.
An update, as of a computer program. Lit. newest issue. Cf. hoʻopuka hoʻoponopono ʻia, hōʻano hou.
To speak plainly, frankly, bluntly, crudely, without regard to feelings of others.
To adhere to another and not to one’s proper lord; ka! kupaianaha, no'u aku kuu aina, a hoopukaku oe i kou waiwai mamuli o ke alii.
Redup. of hoʻopuka.
See PUKA. To push forward; to make prominent.
To charge interest or per cent. on goods.
To answer or reply back and forth; to show one’s skill in answering again; to contradict, as two who are obstinate in conversation.
To invest. Kea hoʻopukapuka. Stock, as in the stock market. Mea hoʻopukapuka kālā. Investment. Also hoʻopukapuka.
To collect, assemble.
Caus/sim of pūkuʻi.
Hard-hearted; close-fisted; selfish.
See OPU and KUMOA, to be sour. To be evilly disposed; to be envious.
To be greedy after property.
To be sour and selfish in disposition.
Saving, miserly.
Same as above and transitive.
To cherish.
To stir up to action, hurry.
See lale and pūlale, to hurry; to scare fish. To hurry; to hasten; to make a stir in doing a thing.
To encourage strongly.
Street name.
See pulapula, seedling.
See PULA and PULAPULA, the tops of sugar-cane. To plant in order to increase vegetables; to propagate by planting; to begin to plant a new kind of vegetable.
To collect, bring many things together.
To blow.
See PULELEHUA, a butterfly. To blow away, as small bits of paper.
To act the butterfly; to flutter about, as vain dressy persons.
To talk much with little sense.
To filibuster, i.e., make a long speech in order to prevent action on a legislative bill.

example_txt.txt: Hoʻopulelehua aku nei ke kenekoa he ʻehiku hola me ka manaʻolana e hala ka wā no ke koho pāloka.
The senator filibustered for seven hours in hopes that the time would lapse for the vote to take place.

definitions.dtxt: To gird on.
To bud, form shoots.
Street name.

definitions.der: [Lit. put in together [for a] long [time]. (Omokaʻa and his wife Okoe lived here; any travelers entering their house were put into an oven, where they stayed together a long time. Finally Omokaʻa and Okoe were pushed into a net by Kamiki and his brother. They were spared when they promised not to harm travelers again. See Okoe, Omokaʻa]
definitions.dtxt: Quadrangle, land section, bay, and village, Kona, southwest Hawaiʻi; site of a lava flow in 1926)
To blindfold, veil.
See pūloʻu, to veil the head. To cover the head with a kapa.
To sit bending the head down so as to keep warm.
To take a steam bath.
See pulu, wet, and pulu, mulch. To act the fool.
To deceive; to act treacherously; to get the advantage of one by deceit.
To manure; hoʻopulu loʻi.
To cause body odor; to sweat offensively. He maʻi hoʻopuluea poʻo, a disease to make the head sweat [of trouble].
Strong smelling; stinking.
Deceitful; hypocritical.
To cause a stench; to make an offensive smell.
To deceive.
To protest against.

See PUMEHANA. To warm, as by fire; to warm by covering with clothes; to warm up, as food.
To warm, heat.
See PUMEHANA. To warm, as by fire; to warm by covering with clothes; to warm up, as food.
Same as hoʻopunalua.
To treat as a favorite, make a favorite, indulge. Hōʻike ka makua i kona hoʻopunahele i kāna wahine (Kep. 165), the parent showed how he treated his wife as a great favorite.

To grow moldy, musty; to cause mildew.
See PUNAHELU, mould, spiders' webs, etc. To grow mouldy or musty; to grow old.

See PUNALUA. To have, as a man, another woman equally beloved as his wife; to have, as a woman, another man equally beloved as her husband.
To make a nest, to settle in a nest or over young; to sit on eggs, as a hen; to take shelter. Hoʻopūnana ka manaʻo, to set the mind on, plan, focus attention on.

To hatch eggs by warming them.
To brood or cherish, as a fowl her young.
To warm, as a person by the fire.
To nest. Kau hoʻopūnana. Nesting season.
Street name.
To fool, deceive easily.
To be charmed by, desire greatly.
To deceive, fool, delude.

See PUNI, to surround. To come around; to surround.
To get the advantage of; to deceive; to beguile.
To be charmed with; to desire much, as the desire of the sexes. Laieik. 38.
To fascinate, charm, captivate, ensnare, decoy, trap.
To demonstrate pleasure at seeing one, as a child or dog; to cling to as with delight, frisk about happily; to perform ritual with the object of pleasing the gods (rare).
Caus/sim of pūnini. Ke hoʻopūnini maila ka iʻa, the fish are drifting here.

To dye red with this dye.
See NONI, a plant. To be or to make of a reddish color; to be brown.

See PUNONO, to dress gorgeously. To be noble; to dress gorgeously.
To have red eyes.
Caus/sim of pūnonohu.

Caus/sim of puʻō.
Caus/sim of puoho.
To think, surmise, want. ʻEā, ua piʻo ka uahi lepo i ka lani, ke hōʻopuʻopu lā kō ia ala kupa (chant), oh, the dusk cloud bends in the sky, the native son is speculating.

To be deep.
To spread abroad, as the ocean.
To spread out, as all the sails of a ship.
For hoopuupuu. See PUUPUU. A collection of things; a gathering up.
An old person, from his walking in a stumbling, irregular manner.
See PUPU, a bunch, as of grass or leaves. To collect together; to heap up. See HOOPUU.
To be uncomfortably filled with food. See HOOKUKU.
To hinder; to be unwilling; to refuse; to hold fast.
To cleave to one’s home when driven or invited away.
To breathe quick and short, as an aged person; hence,
To be feeble and tottering; to walk like an aged person.
To dispute; to converse roughly.
Var. of hōpupū
To make ugly, disfigure, deform.
See PUKA and PUPUKA, worthless; full of holes. To speak contemptibly.
To act disgracefully.
To be ugly to look at.
Same as hoʻopukupuku.
To make insane; to drive crazy; to act crazy, pretend to be crazy.
See PUPULE, crazy. To make one crazy; to be out of one’s wits; to be insane.
Caus/sim of pupuni.
To heap up, collect in heaps; to frown; resentment. Cf. hoʻopuʻukahua.
A fullness of resentment of one against another; e kuu aku i kou hoopuu i pau, let loose all your resentment.
See PUU, a heap. To collect together; to collect in heaps; to lay up in store.
To fill up, as the belly with wind; to fill, as the heart with resentment; hoopuu ae la ka'u ia ia i kana hoahewa ana ia'u.
To make ridiculous gestures or faces in ridicule of others. See HOOPUUKAHUA and HOOMALOKA.
To choke.
See puʻua, to be choked. To push away; to treat with dislike.
To be choked; to have hard labor, as a female.
Same as huahua; to ridicule, belittle, taunt.
See hoʻopuʻu above. To make ridiculous faces and gestures to the disparagement of others.
To ensnare, entrap. (And.)
Caus/sim of pūʻulu.
To group, in math; to form or break into groups. See pūʻulu.
To clench the fist, to shake the fist threateningly.
See hoʻopuʻu. To lay in heaps; to collect.
See PUWA, to ascend, as smoke. To hang suspended, as a flag, or as smoke or clouds in the air.
To act proudly, as above others.
To glitter with brightness.
Var. of hōʻū
To cause to perch.
See UA, rain. To cause it to rain; to give or cause rain.
Open; free to enter, as a harbor; e komo no na moku manuwa iloko o na awa a pau i hoouaaia.
To smoke, emit smoke, cure by smoking.

To smoke, as meat or fish.
Caus/sim of uai.
To stiffen. Ua hoʻouāniʻi i kona kino me ka ʻoʻoleʻa loa, stiffened his body with all his might.
To be tight; strong; to draw along.
To cause weeping, make someone cry.
See UE and UWE. To cause one to cry; to cry out for pain or grief.
See UEUE, to shake. To cause a shaking; to bend; to crook; to move along a little.
Caus/sim of uēuē. to imitate wailing; a wailing dirge.
Intensive of hooue above. To cry out; to sob; to sigh; to grieve; to mourn; to cry long; to wail.
To draw tightly.
To bring out; to unfold.
To fatigue; to tire.
See HENEHENE. To laugh secretly at one; to mock ironically.
See UHI, to cover up. To overspread; to cover up; to wrap up; to put out of sight by covering up.
To prepare uhiuhi wood for house posts (GP 8).
See UHI as above. To cover up; to conceal in various ways; to cover over; to hide from view.
To tease, annoy, vex, nag.
To trouble; to vex.
Street name.
To beautify, make beautiful.
See uʻi.
Var. of hōʻuila.
Caus/sim of uiui. Hoʻolaʻi nā manu ke ʻike i ka wai hoʻouiui kino (chant), the birds are calmed when they see the liquid that excites the body.
To beautify, make attractive. Mea hoʻouʻiuʻi, cosmetics.
To put on makeup. Niʻihau. Aia ʻo Tita ke noho nei i mua o ke aniani me ka hoʻouʻiuʻi pū. Tita’s sitting in front of the mirror putting on makeup. Also hoʻonaninani.
To load, as cargo or freight; to put on, as gear on a horse; to send, as a letter.

example_txt.txt: to attack, battle, wage a military campaign

definitions.dtxt: To rush on, as in battle; to attack, raid. Cf. kahua hoʻouka.
See uka.
La hoouka, day of battle; day of attack.
See UKA, to send; convey. To put or lay upon, as to lade a horse or other animal; to put on board a canoe or vessel; to freight; to send property by ship.
To attack, as an enemy; to make an attack; to rush upon, as in battle.
To load, as a computer program; to install, as software. Cf. hoʻoili.
